quote: Who are they to give stars or dots? They're Wemmicks just like you."Eli to Punchinello (p. 25)
author: Max Lucado, You Are Special

quote: And stop talking in that puffed-up way they taught you. Words aren't brains, you know.
author: Deepak Chopra, The Return of Merlin

quote: Never make the first move." - Loor (The Rivers of Zadaa)
author: D.J. MacHale

quote: Be hated. One does not have to be evil to be hated. In fact, it’s often the case that one is hated precisely because one is trying to do right by one’s own convictions. It is far too easy to be liked, one merely has to be accommodating and hold no strong convictions. Then one will gravitate towards the centre and settle into the average. That cannot be your role. There are a great many bad people in the world, and if you are not offending them, you must be bad yourself.
author: Adrian Tan

quote: When you encounter seemingly good advice that contradicts other seemingly good advice, ignore them both.
author: Al Franken

quote: Never have children, only grandchildren.
author: Gore Vidal

quote: Human evolution has two steps - from being somebody to being nobody
author: and from being nobody to being everybody.This knowledge can bring sharing and caring throughout the world.

quote: Give every man thine ear, but few thy voice; Take each man's censure, but reserve thy judgment.
author: William Shakespeare, Hamlet

quote: I need voices of reason and of hysteria and of empathy. I need to have an Alanis moment. I need advice from Elizabeth Bennett. I need Tim Tams and comfort food.
author: Melina Marchetta, Saving Francesca

quote: I have never yet figured out what to do about good advice that you get, and that you know right away would help you, but that you cannot follow.
author: Holly Lisle, The Silver Door

quote: Great News! If you quit being cunty the whole world will stop being against you!
author: Sarah Silverman

quote: Never miss a chance...to keep your mouth shut.
author: Robert Newton Peck, A Day No Pigs Would Die

quote: Never take advice from a donkey.
author: Bryce Courtenay, The Power of One

quote: Gran, for the gods' love, it's talk like yours that starts riots!" I said keeping my voice down. "Will you just put a stopper in it?"She looked at me and sighed. "Girl, do you ever take a breath and wonder if folk don't put out bait for you? To see if you'll bite? You'll never get a man if you don't relax."My dear old Gran. It's a wonder her children aren't every one of them as mad as priests, if she mangles their wits as she mangles mine."Granny, "I told her, "this is dead serious. I can't relax, no more than any Dog. I'm not shopping for a man. That's the last thing I need.
author: Tamora Pierce, Bloodhound
category: advice, baiting, bickering, crazy, family-relationship, granddaughter, grandmother, humor, single-women

quote: People make mistakes, it's just part of life. But, it's what we do with those mistakes that matters. What matters is what we learn from the mistakes, not what the mistake is.
author: Chris Hankin

quote: If you are going to worry, don't do it. If you do it, don't worry.
author: Michael Nolan

quote: Every human being, he believed, must do one of three basic things during his lifetime: leave something living, create something lovely, or make something better.
author: Renée Manfredi, Above the Thunder

quote: Until you stalk and overrun, you cannot devour anyone.-Hobbes
author: Bill Watterson

quote: Honor your mistake as a hidden intention.
author: Brian Eno

quote: Most dancers I know, especially the talented and successful ones, seem to possess [my dog's] knack for living moment to moment. You see, their idea of time is related to those infinitely short moments when they are onstage being their superselves.
author: Paul Taylor, Private Domain: An Autobiography

quote: You come to me for advice, but you can't cope with anything you don't recognize. Hmmm. So we'll have to tell you something you already know but make it sound like news, eh Well, business as usual , I suppose.
author: Douglas Adams, The Ultimate Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy

quote: Just because your voice reaches halfway around the world doesn't mean you're any wiser than when it reached only to the end of the bar.
author: Edward R. Murrow

quote: Sometimes the best advice comes from those whom you least expect…therefore take no one for granted
author: Jeremy Aldana

quote: My father always told me: 'Give somebody a hand and he'll take an arm.
author: Haruki Murakami, Blind Willow, Sleeping Woman

quote: People who ask our advice almost never take it. Yet we should never refuse to give it, upon request, for it often helps us to see our own way more clearly.
author: Brendan Francis Brown

quote: Never give in to peer pressure, especially if the peer is not attractive.
author: Eugene Mirman, The Will to Whatevs: A Guide to Modern Life

quote: It is the thinnest lines that define us.
author: David Macinnis Gill, Black Hole Sun

quote: At one time I thought the most important thing was talent. I think now that — the young man or the young woman must possess or teach himself, train himself, in infinite patience, which is to try and to try and to try until it comes right. He must train himself in ruthless intolerance. That is, to throw away anything that is false no matter how much he might love that page or that paragraph. The most important thing is insight, that is ... curiosity to wonder, to mull, and to muse why it is that man does what he does. And if you have that, then I don't think the talent makes much difference, whether you've got that o
author: William Faulkner
category: advice, craft, craftsmanship, creative-writing, learning-by-doing, talent, training, trial-and-error, writing, writing-process

quote: For the advice in a joke is sometimes more useful than the most serious teaching.
author: Baltasar Gracián, The Art of Worldly Wisdom

quote: The Director's Role: You are the obstetrician. You are not the parent of this child we call the play. You are present at its birth for clinical reasons, like a doctor or midwife. Your job most of the time is simply to do no harm.When something does go wrong, however, your awareness that something is awry--and your clinical intervention to correct it--can determine whether the child will thrive or suffer, live or die.
author: Frank Hauser, Notes on Directing

quote: I feel very strongly about putting questions; it partakes too much of the style of the day of judgement. You start a question, and it's like starting a stone. You sit quietly on the top of a hill; and away the stone goes, starting others; and presently some bland old bird (the last you would have thought of) is knocked on the head in his own back garden, and the family have to change their name. No, sir, I make it a rule of mine: the more it looks like Queer Street, the less I ask.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson, The Strange Case of Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde

quote: Never pay attention to someone who has not earned your respect.
author: Habeeb Akande

quote: If you want the law to leave you alone, keep your hair trimmed and your boots shined.
author: Louis L'Amour, The Man Called Noon

quote: Never offer advice just to appear concerned.
author: Jack Gardner, Words Are Not Things

quote: Dear Aspiring Writer, you are not ready. Stop. Put that finished story away and start another one. In a month, go back and look at the first story. RE-EDIT it. Then send it to a person you respect in the field who will be hard on you. Pray for many many many red marks. Fix them. Then put it away for two weeks. Work on something else. Finally, edit one last time. Now you are ready to sub your first work.Criticism is hard to take at first. Trust me, I've been there. But learn to think of crit marks as a knife. Each one is designed to cut away the bad and leave a scar. Scars prove you've lived, learned and walked away a winner. Any writer who tells you they don't need edits is lying. I don't care if they have 100 books out. Edits make you grow and if you aren't growing as a writer, you are dead.
author: Inez Kelley

quote: Stay stupid. Follow your unconventional, crazy heart.
author: Steven Pressfield, Do the Work

quote: A verbal contract is worth about as much as the paper it's written on.
author: Samuel Goldwyn

quote: It's the story of my life. You see, the quality of any advice anybody has to offer has to be judged against the quality of life they actually lead. Now, as you look through this document you'll see that I've underlined all the major decisions I ever made to make the stand out. They're all indexed and cross-referenced. See? All I can suggest is that if you take decisions that are exactly opposite to the sort of decisions that I've taken, then maybe you won't finish up at the end of your life" --she paused, and filled her lungs for a good should--"in a smelly old cave like this!
author: Douglas Adams, The Ultimate Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy

quote: It hurts when you lose a friend to death, it hurts even more when you lose a friend still living.
author: C.J. Tulli

quote: I have changed my mind, and changed the trimmings of my cap this morning; they are now such as you suggested.
author: Jane Austen

quote: One bullet can really fuck up your day.
author: Mark Haskell Smith, Baked

quote: No. The moral of the story in so far as it has one is that cannibals can study logic, and that if you are going to leave the path, you better have your wits about you and know better than to trust the first scary old lady who talks to you in public.
author: Nick Harkaway, The Gone-Away World

quote: Of course, to avoid getting stuck in that convo with someone you dislike or feel uncomfortable around, don't be passive, be proactive. Do not let them direct your interaction on their terms, do it on yours. Ask a Misdirection Question--something too difficult to answer quickly--e.g., 'What's Congress up to?' or 'You ever learn any cool science?' When you ask the question, don't make eye contact, keep moving and get out of there. Do not wait for a response and deny ever asking it. Repeat these actions until you are never again spoken to by that individual (about four times).
author: Eugene Mirman, The Will to Whatevs: A Guide to Modern Life

quote: Here's the last thing that occurs to me as Sarah recedes in the rearview mirror, slamming out of the car, jogging across the parking lot: If you're one tardy away from missing out on a big competition, you should probably make your coffee at home.
author: Lauren Oliver, Before I Fall

quote: Why do you do that?Do what?Blow off compliments.I don't.You kind of do.Sorry.Don't apologize. Just learn to say thanks.
author: Marisa Reichardt, Underwater

quote: I go on the presumption that everyone's full of shit until proven otherwise, and this usually serves me in good stead.
author: Dennis Lehane, A Drink Before the War

quote: It's good advice, but I expect it will be hard to follow; good advice is apt to be, I think.
author: L.M. Montgomery, Anne of Green Gables

quote: In the shower today I tried to think about the best advice I'd ever been given by another writer. There was something that someone said at my first Milford, about using style as a covering, but sooner or later you would have to walk naked down the street, that was useful...And then I remembered. It was Harlan Ellison about a decade ago.He said, "Hey. Gaiman. What's with the stubble? Every time I see you, you're stubbly. What is it? Some kind of English fashion statement?""Not really.""Well? Don't they have razors in England for Chrissakes?""If you must know, I don't like shaving because I have a really tough beard and sensitive skin. So by the time I've finished shaving I've usually scraped my face a bit. So I do it as little as possible.""Oh." He paused. "I've got that too. What you do is, you rub your stubble with hair conditioner. Leave it a couple of minutes, then wash it off. Then shave normally. Makes it really easy to shave. No scraping."I tried it. It works like a charm. Best advice from a writer I've ever received.
author: Neil Gaiman

quote: It costs nothing to ask wise advice from a good friend.
author: George S. Clason, The Richest Man in Babylon

quote: I said, "I don't think I can give you that kind of emotion." And he [Hitchcock] sat there and said, "Ingrid, fake it!" Well, that was the best advice I've had in my whole life, because in all the years to come there were many directors who gave me what I thought were quite impossible instructions and many difficult things to do, and just when I was on the verge of starting to argue with them, I heard his voice coming to me through the air saying, "Ingrid, fake it!" It saved a lot of unpleasant situations and waste of time.
author: Ingrid Bergman

quote: For the love of God, unless you’re prepping for Rigoletto at the Met, go easy on the eyeliner.
author: Cheryl Cory
category: advice, excess, eyeliner, makeup, opera, teenagers, teens

quote: Find out what people want to do, then tell them to do it. They'll think you're a genius.
author: Connie Brockway, The Bridal Season

quote: Who would condescend to strike down the mere things that he does notfear? Who would debase himself to be merely brave, like any commonprizefighter? Who would stoop to be fearless--like a tree? Fight thething that you fear. You remember the old tale of the English clergymanwho gave the last rites to the brigand of Sicily, and how on hisdeath-bed the great robber said, 'I can give you no money, but I cangive you advice for a lifetime: your thumb on the blade, and strikeupwards.' So I say to you, strike upwards, if you strike at the stars.
author: G.K. Chesterton, The Man Who Was Thursday: A Nightmare

quote: Never ask while you are doing it if what you are doing is fun. Don't introduce even your most reliably witty acquaintance as someone who will set the table on a roar.
author: Christopher Hitchens, Hitch-22: A Memoir

quote: Be willing to die for your beliefs, or computer printouts of your beliefs.
author: Don DeLillo, Great Jones Street

quote: I'm very wary about giving advice. I think it's very dangerous to give advice to people, except if you know them very well.
author: Omar Sharif

quote: Conscience is like a pet: If you spoil it by too much attention it'll start yipping at the most inopportune times.
author: Connie Brockway, The Bridal Season

quote: Advice is what we ask for when we already knew the answer but wish we didn't.
author: John C. Maxwell, The 360 Degree Leader: Developing Your Influence from Anywhere in the Organization

quote: Title: What Can a Thoughtful Man Hope for Mankind on Earth, Given the Experience of the Past Million Years? Only verse: Nothing.
author: Kurt Vonnegut Jr.

quote: And all of the scientific data, statistical facts and empirical evidence can't compete with the indefinable heart's desire. For if in the end, she loves you, and she chooses you…none of the rest of this will matter.
author: Ruth Clampett, Animate Me

quote: I would rather be confused for 10 minutes than bored for 5 seconds.
author: Russell T. Davies

quote: Here are the two states in which you may exist: person who writes, or person who does not. If you write: you are a writer. If you do not write: you are not. Aspiring is a meaningless null state that romanticizes Not Writing. It’s as ludicrous as saying, “I aspire to pick up that piece of paper that fell on the floor.” Either pick it up or don’t. I don’t want to hear about how your diaper’s full. Take it off or stop talking about it.
author: Chuck Wendig

quote: No real lady would let a dress that might have been worn by a stranger touch her skin.
author: Cassandra Clare, Clockwork Angel

quote: Now go and make interesting mistakes, make amazing mistakes, make glorious and fantastic mistakes. Break rules. Leave the world more interesting for your being here.
author: Neil Gaiman, Make Good Art

quote: Love will hurt. If it doesn't hurt you are not doing it right. To truly love someone you must open yourself up to the pain that would be losing them.
author: Teresa Mummert

quote: Be careful whose advice you buy, but be patient with those who supply it. Advice is a form of nostalgia.
author: Mary Schmich, Wear Sunscreen: A Primer for Real Life

quote: I realize that advice is worth what it costs--that is, nothing.
author: Douglas MacArthur

quote: I think that when you invite people to your home, you invite them to yourself.
author: Oprah Winfrey, My Life

quote: If you have to think about it twice you probably shouldn't do it
author: Sophia Nam

quote: Do whatever you want. Break stuff, touch your penis or boobs to anything, whatever.
author: Eugene Mirman, The Will to Whatevs: A Guide to Modern Life

quote: I admonish Your Majesty, as the woman who gave you life and loves you like no other, to behave always in a manner that safeguards your immortal soul. Seek God's glory in the Holy Land rather than your own, that I may see you in heaven if never again in France.
author: Sophie Perinot, The Sister Queens

quote: Over the years I've received thousands of e-mails looking for guidance. Some have real problems
author: some talk about monkeys and poo--though those people may also have real problems.
category: Eugene Mirman, The Will to Whatevs: A Guide to Modern Life

quote: If someone gives you so-called good advice, do the opposite; you can be sure it will be the right thing nine out of 10 times.
author: Anselm Feurbah

quote: Here is the solution to the American drug problem suggested a couple years back by the wife of our President: "Just say no.
author: Kurt Vonnegut Jr., Bluebeard

quote: When faced with 2 choices, simply toss a coin. It works not because it settles the question for you. But because in that brief moment when the coin is in the air YOU SUDDENLY KNOW WHAT YOUR HOPING FOR. :)
author: wisdom quotes

quote: All the well-meaning advice in the world won't amount to a hill of beans if we're not even addressing the real problem.
author: Stephen R. Covey, The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People: Powerful Lessons in Personal Change

quote: Perhaps you should put your head down.” I knew this was the thing to do, although I’ve never fainted and I don’t intend to.
author: Franny Billingsley, Chime

quote: Drinking is something people do; it's not what you are. But when it becomes what you are, you need to think about becoming something else.
author: Tim Cowlishaw, Drunk on Sports

quote: The only way to get smarter is by playing a smarter opponent.
author: Fundamentals of Chess 1883

quote: Hugs can do great amounts of good - especially for children." -Diana
author: Kate Petrella, Royal Wisdom: The Most Daft, Cheeky, and Brilliant Quotes from Britain's Royal Family

quote: No one knows, at sight a masterpiece.And give up verse, my boy,There's nothing in it.Likewise a friend of Bloughram's once advised me:Don't kick against the pricks,Accept opinion. The Nineties tried your gameAnd died, there's nothing in it.
author: Ezra Pound, Selected Poems of Ezra Pound

quote: The safe and cultural method of eating crackers in bed is to wear a diver's suit instead of pajamas.
author: Basil Wolverton, The Culture Corner

quote: A hot lust for glory, gems, gold or mates,Leads reckless young drakes to the blackest of fates.
author: E.E. Knight, Dragon Champion

quote: Formerly...when he tried to do anything for the good of everybody, for humanity...for the whole village, he had noticed that the thoughts of it were agreeable, but the activity itself was always unsatisfactory; there was no full assurance that the work was really necessary, and the activity itself, which at first seemed so great, ever lessened and lessened till it vanished. But now...when he began to confine himself more and more to living for himself, though he no longer felt any joy at the thought of his activity, he felt confident that his work was necessary, saw that it progressed far better than formerly, and that it was always growing more and more.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Send me all the advice you like. I'll use as much as I can.
author: Louisa May Alcott

quote: The malpractice for advice-giving is like five times as much as a craniotomy.
author: Nicole Krauss, Man Walks Into a Room

quote: A living being either creates or destroys...some choice.
author: Mike Redican

quote: I feel obligated to tell you that adventures are, on a whole, stunningly bad ideas, best avoided at all costs.
author: Michael McClung, The Thief Who Pulled on Trouble's Braids

quote: It's always better to attack than to defend," Coram had told her when they talked about fencing late at night. "Always. Ye don't win with defense--ye only hold the other feller off, or wear him down. Attack and have done with it!
author: Tamora Pierce, Alanna: The First Adventure
category: advice, attacking, defense, fighting, offense, tactics

quote: If you have to hit--hit low.
author: Tamora Pierce

quote: Her father sat her down and spoke to her with great seriousness. "You are not a witch, Katerina. There is magic in the world, and some of it is wholesome, and some of it is not, but it is a thing that is in the blood, and it is not in yours."The foolish will always treat you badly, because they think you are not beautiful," he said, and she knew this was true. Plain Kate. She was a plain as a stick and thin as a stick and flat as a stick. Her nose was too long and her brows too strong. Her father kissed her twice, once above each brow. "We cannot help what fools think. But understand, it is your skill with a blade that draws this talk. If you want to give up your carving, you have my blessing.""I will never give it up," she answered.
author: Erin Bow, Plain Kate
category: advice, appearence, daughter, determination, father, looks, talent, taunting, unkindness

quote: Advice is a form of Nostalgia
author: Mary Schmich, Wear Sunscreen: A Primer for Real Life

quote: Knowledge in the head and virtue in the heart, time devoted to study or business, instead of show and pleasure, are the way to be useful and consequently happy.
author: John  Adams

quote: If you forget your lines, you had better mumble with conviction.
author: Connie Brockway, The Bridal Season

quote: If things are really overwhelming and you need to talk, you can give me a call at 347-273-2044.
author: Eugene Mirman, The Will to Whatevs: A Guide to Modern Life

quote: The urge to move is natural and understandable. As will be the case throughout your life, no matter how long or brief, the choice is, in the end, yours. Simply bear in mind that most every choice will have consequences, and in this instance those consequences would likely be quite grave.
author: Ron Currie Jr., Everything Matters!
category: advice, choice, everything-matters, life, move, ron-currie-jr

quote: The lower your decolletage, the less the need for conversation.
author: Connie Brockway, The Bridal Season

quote: If you enjoy sticking a straw in a dog's ear, don't sit next to the pooch with a milkshake.
author: Alan Rogers, Lyam's Journal

quote: Light tomorrow with today.
author: George Barnard Moore, Gertrude Stein's The Making of Americans: Repetition and the Emergence of Modernism

quote: There's an ad for every vice. That's advice.
author: Brian Spellman, If the mind fits, shrink it

quote: I know now that what makes a fool is an inability to take even his own good advice.
author: William Faulkner, Light in August

quote: Mark it, nuncle.Have more than thou showest,Speak less than thou knowest,Lend less than thou owest,Ride more than thou goest,Learn more than thou trowest,Set less than thou throwest,Leave thy drink and thy whoreAnd keep in-a-door,And thou shalt have moreThan two tens to a score.
author: William Shakespeare, King Lear

quote: What did being connected to the world get you? It got you sadder. Look, the world is not sane. If you stay connected to an insane world, well, you just go crazy. This is not a complicated theory. It's just simple logic.
author: Benjamin Alire Sáenz, Last Night I Sang to the Monster

quote: A word of advice, my sweet Emmett - mourn the losses because they are many. But celebrate the victories because they are few.
author: Debbie Novotny

quote: Whenever a person says to you that they are as innocent as lambs in all concerning money, look well after your own money, for they are dead certain to collar it, if they can. Whenever a person proclaims to you 'In worldly matters I'm a child,' you consider that that person is only a crying off from being held accountable, and that you have got that person's number, and it's Number One. Now, I am not a poetical man myself, except in a vocal way, when it goes round a company, but I'm a practical one, and that's my experience. So's this rule. Fast and loose in one thing, Fast and loose in everything. I never knew it fail. No more will you. Nor no one.
author: Charles Dickens, Bleak House

quote: This is the most beautiful piece of advice I can offer. I you don't have what you want now, you don't have what you want.
author: Ann Brashares, Sisterhood Everlasting

quote: Sometimes rising above is the only way to stop the hate from spreading. It's not what anyone expects, and it does make them stop and think.
author: Madelyn Alt, Where There's a Witch

quote: But if you will not take this Counsel, and persist in thinking a Commerce with the Sex inevitable, then I repeat my former Advice, that in all your Amours you should prefer old Women to young ones. You call this a Paradox, and demand my Reasons. They are these:1. Because as they have more Knowledge of the World and their Minds are better stor'd with Observations, their Conversation is more improving and more lastingly agreable.2. Because when Women cease to be handsome, they study to be good. To maintain their Influence over Men, they supply the Diminution of Beauty by an Augmentation of Utility. They learn to do a 1000 Services small and great, and are the most tender and useful of all Friends when you are sick. Thus they continue amiable. And hence there is hardly such a thing to be found as an old Woman who is not a good Woman.3. Because there is no hazard of Children, which irregularly produc'd may be attended with much Inconvenience.4. Because thro' more Experience, they are more prudent and discreet in conducting an Intrigue to prevent Suspicion. The Commerce with them is therefore safer with regard to your Reputation. And with regard to theirs, if the Affair should happen to be known, considerate People might be rather inclin'd to excuse an old Woman who would kindly take care of a young Man, form his Manners by her good Counsels, and prevent his ruining his Health and Fortune among mercenary Prostitutes.5. Because in every Animal that walks upright, the Deficiency of the Fluids that fill the Muscles appears first in the highest Part: The Face first grows lank and wrinkled; then the Neck; then the Breast and Arms; the lower Parts continuing to the last as plump as ever: So that covering all above with a Basket, and regarding2 only what is below the Girdle, it is impossible of two Women to know an old from a young one. And as in the dark all Cats are grey, the Pleasure of corporal Enjoyment with an old Woman is at least equal, and frequently superior, every Knack being by Practice capable of Improvement.6. Because the Sin is less. The debauching a Virgin may be her Ruin, and make her for Life unhappy.7. Because the Compunction is less. The having made a young Girl miserable may give you frequent bitter Reflections; none of which can attend the making an old Woman happy.8thly and Lastly They are so grateful!!Thus much for my Paradox. But still I advise you to marry directly; being sincerely Your affectionate Friend.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: IT helps to think of the whole development thing as a process; you go in looking like a girl, and you'll come out at the other end looking like a woman. The stuff in the middle is just what everyone goes through, it;s almost never much fun.
author: Philip Van Munching, Boys Will Put You on a Pedestal (So They Can Look Up Your Skirt): A Dad's Advice for Daughters

quote: You must read to lead. Reading feeds. It opens our souls to a long line of counselors.
author: Dave Harvey, Am I Called?: The Summons to Pastoral Ministry

quote: Adventure, my dear, is as much a state of mind as anything else. One can travel the world and never find the excitement to be found within arm's reach.Remain true to yourself, but understand happiness may not always be found in the plans we have laid out for ourselves, but rather in the unforeseen turns life takes us. Do not close your mind, or your heart, to the unexpected twists of life. It is those unexpected paths that could well lead to the greatest adventures of all.
author: Victoria Alexander, The Marriage Lesson

quote: ...after rare beef and wine, when the lobes turn red, was the time to ask favours or tell bad news.
author: M.F.K. Fisher, The Art of Eating

quote: Horrible the fate of the advice-giver in our culture: to repeat oneself in a thousand contexts until death, or irrelevance.            *I abjure advice-giver.
author: Frank Bidart, Star Dust

quote: I don't advise. You mutn't give any weight to what I say, except in so far as your own judgment approves it.
author: George Gissing

quote: Too often, people think that solving the world's problems is based on conquering the Earth, rather than touching the Earth, touching ground.
author: Chogyam Trungpa Rinpoche

quote: Unsolicited advice is the junk mail of life.
author: Bern Williams

quote: From then on, I was terrified that I or one of my parents were going to die. My mother worried me the most. She was the force around which our world turned. Unlike our father, who spent his life in the clouds, my mother was propelled through the universe by the brute force of reason. She was the judge in all of our arguments. One disapproving word from her was enough to send us off to hide in a corner, where we would cry and fantasize our own martyrdrom. And yet. One kiss could restore us to princedom. Without her, our lives would dissolve into chaos.
author: Nicole Krauss, The History of Love
category: advice, chaos, father, growing-up, life, mother, motherhood, parents

quote: I have found food general guidelines are: be polite, be pleasant, be brief. When even that is too much to manage, pick a quiet corner and look at everyone like they are the greatest of disappointments. Obey royalty, be respectful to those above you, ignore or indulge those below you, and always be generous to staff and tradesmen. One loyal servant is worth then kings.
author: Megan Derr, The Painted Crown

quote: Don't knock homespun. All comfort food is homespun, and according to you and my cooking magazines, comfort food is the trend. You do what you do, do it as best you can, and if you don't win, at least you know you didn't compromise who you are in an effort to please someone else.
author: Stacey Ballis, Wedding Girl

quote: the thing you are mostafraid to writewrite that-- advice to young writers
author: Nayyirah Waheed, Salt

quote: ...we ought not meanwhile to make use of doubt in the conduct of life.
author: René Descartes, Principles of Philosophy

quote: Okay, fuck the sundial. We'll just go straight and eventually we'll get there. What I mean is that we'll get somewhere. Out of here. I mean, logically, we have to get out as long as we walk straight. I've done this millions of times. Whenever everything's killing me, I just say to myself, screw it, and go straight ahead.
author: Susan Orlean, The Orchid Thief: A True Story of Beauty and Obsession

quote: Lord Henry smiled. "He gives you good advice, I suppose. People are very fond of giving away what they need most themselves.
author: Oscar Wilde, The Picture of Dorian Gray

quote: It’s maybe impossible to escape (your own head), but I guess the secret is the prison cell just gets bigger and bigger and bigger and prettier and prettier and prettier.
author: David Lynch
category: advice, existential, existentialism, insanity, inspirational, life, madness, sanity

quote: Be nice, but not too fucking nice.
author: Kristen Lepionka, The Last Place You Look

quote: Now who is wrong and who is right about the dating advice?
author: Deyth Banger, Diary 1

quote: I think the hard work of writing is just how long a book is terrible before it's good.
author: Leigh Bardugo
category: advice, draft, finishing, revision, writing, zero

quote: To help someone, is to understand them
author: Valerio K. Riley, From a Problem Child to Another: And for our Shepherd's

quote: He that will write well in any tongue, must follow this counsel of Aristotle, to speak as the common people do, to think as wise men do: and so should every man understand him, and the judgment of wise men allow him.
author: Roger Ascham

quote: The lessons my parents taught are still with me. I keep a tighter leash when raising my kids than my parents did, but I often find myself doing or saying the same things they did. My mom, for instance, was always cheerful when coming in from work; I try to behave the same way when I finish writing for the day. My dad would listen intently when I came to him with a problem, to help me find a way to solve it on my own; I try to do the same with my own kids. At night, while I'm tucking my kids in bed, I ask them to tell me three nice things that each of their siblings did for them that day, in the hopes that it will help them grow as close as Micah, Dana, and I did. And more frequently than I ever would have imagined possible growing up, I find myself telling my children "It's your life", or "No one ever promised that life would be fair", and "What you want and what you get are usually two entirely different things".
author: Nicholas Sparks, Three Weeks With My Brother

quote: Take my advice: live your life to the fullest. Breathe the air, taste the wine, kiss the girls, and always remember that the tales of another are never as wondrous as your own.
author: Michael J. Sullivan, Rise of Empire

quote: Treasure the moments, her heart whispered. If you don't learn to treasure the moments, you'll never be able to treasure the memories.
author: Janette Oke, Like Gold Refined

quote: Fine gold is recognized when it is tested.
author: Leonardo da Vinci
category: advice, gold, hard-moments, inspirational, life, tests, tests-of-life

quote: There will come a time when you believe everything is finished. That will be the beginning.
author: Louis L'Amour, Lonely on the Mountain

quote: When one is in love one thinks only of one.
author: Will Advise

quote: No counsel is more sincere than that given on ships which are in danger.
author: Leonardo da Vinci, Thoughts on Art and Life

quote: Find someone who loves you more than you love them.
author: Hannah Lillith Assadi, Sonora

quote: You want some advice?""Yes""Never go to a doctor whose office plants have died.
author: Michael Robotham, Lost

quote: But, I've learned, as we all must, that adults are jerks too. At least some of them. And that's why I feel so strongly that if you have the opportunity to surround yourself with people who aren't jerks, you should not just take it, but grab it, seize it, squeeze the living hell out of it.
author: Clinton Kelly, I Hate Everyone, Except You

quote: Arista," the wizard said, "sharks don't eat seafood because they like it, but because chickens don't swim. We all do the best we can with the tools we have, but at some point you have to ask yourself where the tools came from.
author: Michael J. Sullivan, Theft of Swords

quote: Fate has given you a chance of stepping out of your comfort zone. Take the trip. (Aunt Eve talking to Febronia)
author: Clotilde Martinez, Moura Enchanted

quote: There will be two ships sailing, but you'll be on the Resolution, with Cook himself. Never put yourself in his way. Never speak to him. And if you do speak to him, which you must never do, certainly do to speak to him in the manner in which you have sometimes spoken to me. He will not find it as diverting as I do.
author: Elizabeth Gilbert, The Signature of All Things

quote: The best advice is not to write what you know, it's to write what you like. Write the kind of story you like best- write the story you want to read.
author: Austin Kleon, Steal Like an Artist: 10 Things Nobody Told You About Being Creative

quote: Cereal is Wheat
author: Ash  Bunsee

quote: If you're in the middle of a monumental and devastating life crisis, hang in there. It'll be over in about an hour. Two hours, tops.
author: Anthony Rubino Jr., Life Lessons from Melrose Place

quote: You can't have a decent party for the survivors of a deadly blast without inviting the person who detonated the explosion.
author: Anthony Rubino Jr., Life Lessons from Melrose Place

quote: Some people are hard to forget, but some people are hard to remember.
author: Phil Volatile, Crushed Black Velvet

quote: It's easy to offer advice on trials that have caused you to stumble. It's harder to talk about those that have knocked you flat.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: advice, advice-quotes, experience, giving-advice, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: Giving advice is like seeing an elephant in someone’s path and suggesting they remove it. Heeding advice requires forcing the elephant to budge. Huge difference.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: advice, advice-quotes, giving-advice, heeding-advice, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, suggestions

quote: Never ask another person's advice about anything God makes you decide before Him.
author: Oswald Chambers, My Utmost for His Highest

quote: Rolando pursed his lips and sighed. “Just be careful.” “Why, because her father carries a gun?” Isaac said. “Aren’t you the one who always said guns don’t shoot people?”“No, it was you who said that.” Rolando corrected his son. “I’ve said fathers with guns and beautiful daughters shoot people. Boys in particular.” “You worry too much, dad.” “One day, when you are a father, you will understand.
author: Felix Alexander, The Last Valentine
category: advice, daughters, father-to-son, fatherly-advice, gun, guns, love, romance, shoot, young-love

quote: When people ask for advice they very rarely want your advice and will go ahead and do what they want to do anyway, no matter what you say. That applied in every sort of case; it was a human truth of universal application, but one which most people knew little or nothing about.
author: Alexander McCall Smith, The Full Cupboard of Life

quote: A good life is the result of a thousand small choices and so is a bad one.
author: Karina Bliss, Rise

quote: Best to introduce yourself to patience now, so that it might find you when you call upon it later.
author: Tahereh Mafi, Furthermore

quote: Cautious silence is the refuge of good sense
author: Baltasar Gracián, How to Use Your Enemies

quote: You always apologize for things you don't know. You should stop.
author: Claudia Gray, A Thousand Pieces of You

quote: Before you get in trouble, it pays to ask yourself how you'll get out again.
author: Claudia Gray, A Thousand Pieces of You

quote: Holding a grudge is a fatal flaw.
author: Rick Riordan, The Last Olympian

quote: The path to wisdom leads downward, and anyone who decides to take it had better buckle on armor, remember to bring a sword, and get used to the idea that when and if he gets back everyone he talks to is going to think he's a phony.
author: Peter Straub

quote: Imperfection doesn’t disqualify you from helping others -- it makes you more qualified to give advice in the area you learned from.
author: Adam Kirk Smith

quote: You see, people are everywhere. They are everything. No matter who we are, or what we do, people are involved in our lives. If those people are poisonous, our lives will be poisonous also.
author: S.R. Crawford, From My Suffering: 25 Ways to Break the Chains of Anxiety, Depression & Stress

quote: Darlin'," he drawled, "go when you are invited. Bring good boots, drive slow, take blankets, carry your own salt, but by all means... go where the light is.That's not bad advice, wherever you live. Darlin'.
author: Ellen Stimson, Mud Season: How One Woman's Dream of Moving to Vermont, Raising Children, Chickens and Sheep, and Running the Old Country Store Pretty Much Led to One Calamity After Another

quote: If you agree that the person you were few years ago will take advice from the person you are now, you have made a clear progress in life.
author: Dhaval Gajera, MAKE IT HAPPEN: with 30 greatest life lessons

quote: Don't you think you ought to at least think about getting yourself to your ultimate? Because, trust me, nobody else is going to get you there.
author: Claudia Gray, A Thousand Pieces of You

quote: Look. I don't expect you to spill your guts to me. Your business is your business. Dress how you want to dress. Let people wonder. Fuck 'em."I smile.Solo raised a finger. "But you've got to stop looking for a fight every time someone makes a comment. High school sucks for everyone."I feel my smile fade, and I sit back in the chair. "It kind of feels like you're defending those guys."Solo shrugs. "There will always be guys like Jim Vickers. But I'm not going to let them stop me from doing what I want. And neither should you.
author: Jeff Garvin, Symptoms of Being Human
category: advice, fight, guys, jason-solo, jim-vickers, riley-cavanaugh

quote: You'll do well, Percy. Just remember your strengths and beware your weaknesses.
author: Rick Riordan, The Last Olympian

quote: The perceiving our own weaknesses enables us to give others excellent advice, but it does not teach us to to reform ourselves.
author: William Hazlitt, Plain Speaker

quote: What is the date? What is the time? … Great, that’s what Now is. And every second, your ‘Now’ changes. Because all we have is Now. We are continuously living in the Now. Not yesterday, not tomorrow, but Now. Today. The present. And I need you to live in it. To truly appreciate it. To breathe and feel yourself breathing.
author: S.R. Crawford, From My Suffering: 25 Ways to Break the Chains of Anxiety, Depression & Stress
category: advice, carpe-diem, clean-living, healthy-lifestyle, inspiration, living-in-the-moment, mental-health, mindfulness

quote: Time passes no matter what you do.
author: S.R. Crawford, From My Suffering: 25 Ways to Break the Chains of Anxiety, Depression & Stress
category: advice, inspiration, lifestyle, mental-health, mindfulness, perspective, time

quote: Love yourself! You don’t need a man or a boy or a self-proclaimed love expert to tell you what you’re worth. Your power comes from who you are and what you do! You don't need all that noise, that constant hum in the background telling you whether or not you're good enough. All you need is you, your friends, and your family. And you will find the right person for you, if that's what you want - the one who respects your strength and beauty.
author: Amy Schumer, The Girl with the Lower Back Tattoo

quote: You won't find someone who treats you as you should be treated until you start to believe you are worth the ones you want, the ones who aren't asking you to do any work. Find the man who appreciates you at your best, not one who confirms your worst suspicions about yourself.
author: Mhairi McFarlane, Who’s That Girl?

quote: Nothing's going to change if you're just thinking about it. No matter how much you worry about someone else's problems.... you can't fix it for them.
author: Inio Asano, Solanin

quote: The life that you are about to embrace is not that of a soldier or a commando. It is the way of the assassin.
author: Shatrujeet Nath, The Karachi Deception

quote: I wonderif I should let my hair go greyso my advice will be better.
author: Margaret Atwood, Morning in the Burned House

quote: The requirement for advice being received well is that you’ve produced results with your life. Results are what matters!
author: Adam Kirk Smith

quote: Live for life.
author: Ryker Banister

quote: The desire to love someone always exceeds the desire to be loved by someone & that's exactly why we end up loving the person who doesn't deserve that LOVE. That is why never get into any kind of relationship with a married person because soon you will realize that you were just another episode in their life.
author: KakkZ

quote: What I am recommending to the unmarried person, therefore, comes straight out of the Word: Stay out of bed unless you there alone! I know that advice is difficult to put into practice today. But I didn't make the rules. I'm just passing them along. God's moral laws are not designed to oppress us or deprive us of pleasure. They are there to protect us from the devastation of sin, including disease, heartache, divorce, and spiritual death. Abstinence before marriage and fidelity afterward is the Creator's own plan, and no one has devised a way to improve on it.
author: James C. Dobson, Life on the Edge: A Young Adult's Guide to a Meaningful Future
category: a, advice, alone, bed, creator-s, devastation, devised, difficult, disease, divorce, fidelity, from, god-s, has, heartache, improve, into, it, laws, moral, no-one, on, out, plan, pleasure, practie, protect, put, sin, spiritual-death, stay, to, us, way

quote: A child who grows up too closely aligned with adults assumes knowledge of a life she hasn’t yet experienced.
author: Suzanne Haynes, Loretta Nyhan

quote: You can make your room such a delightful place that they will want to come to you...she is always on hand. Everybody who wants her knows just where to go. If people love her, she gets naturally to be the heart of the house. Once make the little ones feel that your room is the place of all the others to come to when they are tired, or happy, or grieved, or sorry about anything and that the Katy who lives there is sure to give them a loving reception and the battle is won. For you know we never do people good by lecturing.
author: Susan Coolidge, What Katy Did

quote: You know how I say, ‘Don’t ask anyone how to get somewhere unless they have been there?’ Well, I have been there – I have written, been published, found success, and experienced self-doubt, frustration, anger and disappointment along the way … But you know what? I have not been to the place you’re going to. This is your journey. Your destination. Disregard everything in this book. Or embrace it. Better yet: cherry pick. It’s your life.
author: Catherine Deveny, Use Your Words: A Myth-Busting, No-Fear Approach to Writing

quote: If you know you're going to lose something so bad, let it go with your own hand.
author: Amir Sheykhi

quote: to always staying on top of the tables, you have to act like a champion.
author: Amir Sheykhi

quote: ...use design as a secret disguise to infiltrate whatever world you want to go into. If you do that over and over again, and then translate that interest and curiosity into the work that you’re doing, you’ll do great.
author: Michael Bierut

quote: Some things have a natural way of solving themselves. Sometimes you just have to let it go and observe it get solved.
author: Jackson Taviri

quote: The advices you tell your friends were from you're own experiences, and are actually what you need to apply to yourself.
author: Jyca Therese Lauron Livelo

quote: We are all weak most of the time,' she said finally. 'Look at the baby. Born to his mother, he learns how to eat from her, how to walk, talk, hunt, run. He does not invent new ways. He just continues with the old. This is how we all come to the world, James. Weak and needy, desperate to learn how to be a person.' She smiled at him. 'But if we do not like the person we have learned to be, should we just sit in front of our fufu, doing nothing? I think, James, that maybe it is possible to make a new way.
author: Yaa Gyasi, Homegoing

quote: He's an irrelevant person. Learn to spot irrelevant people. Don't expect someone who doesn't know who they are to care who you are.
author: Mhairi McFarlane, Who’s That Girl?

quote: Just be you. That's the best advice I can give. There are seven billion people in this world and there is no one like you.
author: Ed Sheeran, Ed Sheeran: A Visual Journey

quote: The funny thingaboutadvice is,we always tellothersthe thingswecannotreally doourselves.
author: Robert M. Drake

quote: The truth is that writing is simply not reliable. You can't count on it to be there just because you've made some space for it. In fact, making space might make it disappear. You tell yourself you can't write in the middle of your daily life, with all its distractions and commitments, and when you finally clear the decks, light off for someplace scenic or at least private, you sit there completely paralyzed. You have devoted yourself to writing, but it has not returned your devotion. If writing were a person, you would be in an abusive relationship. The healthy thing to do would be to get a restraining order and shut it right out of your heart.
author: Kim Addonizio, Bukowski in a Sundress: Confessions from a Writing Life

quote: Do not afraid of your previous mistakes, try to fix them.
author: Kamaran Ihsan Salih, The Revealed Sense
category: advice, advice-for-daily-living, advice-quotes, kamaran-ihsan-salih, philosophers, philosophical, philosophy-of-life, proverbs

quote: Principles are the simplicity on the far side of complexity.
author: Stephen R. Covey, First Things First

quote: You gotta look out for number one, but don't step in number two!
author: Rodney Dangerfield

quote: ... good advice was sometimes easier to give than receive.
author: Stephen King, Misery

quote: The advice that I have valued in my own life has never turned on fixed maxims or canned metaphors. More crucially, lists of precepts don't work like targeted advice because lists contain inherently constraining messages. They seem to say that complex matters are knowable, that a given process leads to foreseeable results. It implies a thin and predictable world, whereas the sort of advice that has mattered to me bespeaks a quite tentative optimism, the optimism of the quest whose outcome is finally unknowable.
author: Peter D. Kramer, Should You Leave?: A Psychiatrist Explores Intimacy and Autonomy--and the Nature of Advice

quote: A Speechmaker's Prayer: "Let each word of mine be tender and sweet, Just in case someone might make me eat it.
author: Ana Claudia Antunes, A-Z of Happiness: Tips for Living and Breaking Through the Chain that Separates You from Getting That Dream Job
category: advice, approval, searching-for-happiness, searching-for-truth, seeking-for-approval, seeking-for-attention, seeking-truth, speech, speech-quotes, tips

quote: Hold everything very carefully unless it is your lover’s back. Then, become metal, become teeth, do not gentle yourself for any man. Do not change for the ones who think thatyou should be softer, less mouth, less voice. You do not owe regrowth to anyone but yourself. When they begin to ask for you to shape yourself around them, leave. Shut the door firmly. Do not look back.
author: Azra Tabassum, Shaking the Trees

quote: No Son [. . .] Not a traitor to your country. Much worse. A traitor to your soul.
author: Ruta Sepetys, Salt to the Sea
category: advice, corruption, deceit, dishonor, father, florian, guilt, honor, ruta-sepetys, salt-to-the-sea, traitor, traitor-to-the-soul, warning

quote: Honest but gentle communication from the beginning is key.
author: Cheryl Barker, Mother of the Bride: Refreshment and Wisdom for the Mother of the Bride

quote: I used to hammer away at the idea of simplicity.In both fiction and non-fiction, there's only one question and one answer. 'What happened?' the reader asks. 'This is what happened,' the writer responds. 'This...and this...and this, too.' Keep it simple. It's the only sure way home.
author: Stephen King, 11/22/63
category: 11-22-63, advice, experience, insight, life, stephen-king, writing

quote: Just realize that the Mechanics do not exist and are not worthy of your attention. Unless they threaten you, and then you must kill them, Mage Alain. Mechanics are as merciless as they are mercenary. If any appear dangerous, kill them. ...What if he had remembered that advice during the bandit attack, when the Mechanic had pointed her weapon at his face? He could have killed her then. He could have tried at least. Then, when she was dead, the bandits would have found Alain and killed him, too. Clearly the advice of his elders was lacking in some respects.
author: Jack Campbell, The Dragons of Dorcastle

quote: Listen to the advice of someone about to die. Do it while you are still young.
author: Glen McDiarmid

quote: You absolutely will never get everything you hope for. You imperatively HAVE to make the best of what you have. But something that you MUST have and cannot ever ignore is your relationship with people. Always work on that. Understand it as you live. Although people should never complete you as a person, you must have them in your life. That doesn't mean forever, it just means you need people and people need you NO MATTER WHAT.
author: Diana Jaber

quote: The is no better example for our children,then the one we set before them every day
author: Davin Whitehurst

quote: Sometimes silence is not an indicator of not caring, but a way to give time and space to the one who's hurting. Only judge when time passes ad the void widens such that the chasm cannot be bridged.
author: irene fantopoulos

quote: Take the risk, and just be.
author: Dean Del Sesto, Shift Your Thinking: 200 Ways to Improve Your Life

quote: You should choose your battles if you can, but if the battle chooses you then kick the sod in his fuse box!
author: Fredrik Backman, My Grandmother Asked Me to Tell You She's Sorry

quote: Thing was, after the hurricane, life went on. You had to buy milk, fix the broken windows, play some Warhammer, discuss some girls. Wow!
author: Teresa Toten, The Unlikely Hero of Room 13B

quote: You're a superhero. Deal with it.
author: Teresa Toten, The Unlikely Hero of Room 13B
category: advice, hope, inspirational, positive, potivity, uplifting

quote: Some general advice about writing:WRITE MORE, DO OTHER STUFF LESS.
author: Brian K. Vaughan

quote: It's your mind you have to train, like your mom said that one time, you have to separate yourself from all the crap, get down to the core, focus.
author: Cynthia Hand, Unearthly

quote: But hear thee, Gratiano:Thou art too wild, too rude, and bold of voice - Parts that become thee happily enough,And in such eyes as ours appear no faults,But where thou art not known, why, there they show Something too liberal.
author: William Shakespeare, The Merchant of Venice

quote: Third, it is helpful to seek advice from those who are spiritually mature and solid in their faith. A godly counselor or pastor can assist you in avoiding the common mistakes that confuse many young people.
author: James C. Dobson
category: advice, avoiding, common-mistakes, confuse, counselor, godly, many, mature, pastor, seek, spiritually, young-people

quote: Advice is autobiography.
author: J.R. Rim
category: advice, autobiography, book, life, look, look-into, tips, what-to-do, what-to-read

quote: Your advice seems a little ironical.""Oh, you may either follow it or reverse it—that is its chief beauty. It is equally good taken either way.
author: Thomas Henry Lister

quote: Rain clouds and stormy moods take time to blow away, but sooner or later the sun always comes out.
author: Shirley Parenteau, Ship of Dolls

quote: ...once students have been taught that learning is tedious, difficult, and useless, they will never learn another lesson.
author: Robin Hobb, Fool's Assassin
category: advice, decide, determine, difficult, lesson, student, teach, tedious, truth, useless, warning

quote: In Buddhism we would say that you are lazy... Despising yourself, thinking you are no good, saying 'I can't do this.' This is the mind of weakness. You must work to overcome it .
author: David Michie, The Dalai Lama's Cat
category: advice, buddhism, despair, despising-yourself, giving-up, lack-of-self-confidence

quote: . . . [E]very single writer I met likened writing for television to one thing--laying track for an incoming speeding train. The story is the track and you gotta keep laying it down because of the train. That train is production. You keep writing, you keep laying track down, no matter what, because the train of production is coming toward you--no matter what. Every eight days, the crew needs to being to prepare a new episode--find locations, build sets, design costumes, find props, plan shots. And every eight days after that, the crew needs to film a new episode. Every eight days. Eight days to prep. Eight days to shoot. Eight days, eight days, eight days, eight days. Which means every eight days, that crew needs a brand-new script. And my job is to damn well provide them with one. Every. Eight. Days. That train of production is a'coming. Every eight days that crew on that soundstage better have something to shoot. Because the worst thing you can do is halt or derail production and cost the studio hundreds of thousands of dollars while everyone waits. That is how you go from being a TV writer to being a failed TV writer.
author: Shonda Rhimes, Year of Yes: How to Dance It Out, Stand In the Sun and Be Your Own Person

quote: Life was full of so many possibilities - why should you spend even one day of it being bored?
author: Mia Sheridan, Grayson's Vow

quote: The two greatest warriors are Truth and Time. Be sure to march behind, and not against, them.
author: Neel Burton

quote: It was a voice that you felt you had to listen to—or you ignored at your peril.
author: Alexander McCall Smith, The Woman Who Walked in Sunshine

quote: Beware of leaders who prefer controlling 100 % of nothing over sharing a fortune.
author: Julion Okram
category: advice, everything, fortune, greediness, inspirational, moral, nothing, philosophy-of-life, politics, sharing, wisdom

quote: Nevertheless, I sought counsel from my leaders and obeyed, even when I knew their advice would make my life more complicated. I decided it was not for me to question and that if some advice caused temporary pain for me, it must be something I should experience.
author: Gordon B. Hinckley

quote: Embrace each new day with great expectations.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Pearls of  Wisdom: Great  mind
category: advice, christian-life, daily-life, encouragement, expectation, faith, hope, inspirational, morning, new-day, uplifting

quote: It was like Latham: sometimes the point wasn't being the best, because it didn't mean you had the best life, or the best friends, or the best time.
author: Robyn Schneider, Extraordinary Means

quote: If you review on GoodReads - make sure you review on Amazon as well!! Help out an author and leave an Amazon review!
author: Aimee Brown

quote: Wasting time on timing stuff is a good way to save time from being wasted on other pointless activities like writing, reading, and sleeping.
author: Will Advise, Nothing is here...
category: activism, activities, activity, advice, good, nothing, pointless, readers, reading, save, saved, saving, savings, sleepers, sleeping, stuff, things, time, timing, waste, wasted-time, wasting, way, ways, writers, writing

quote: If you cant beat 'em cooperate 'em to death!
author: Charles M. Schulz, Peanuts Guide to Life: Wit and Wisdom from the World's Best-Loved Cartoon Characters

quote: It's a fallacy to believe that age in itself brings wisdom, but one thing it infallibly brings is experience.
author: Gillian Linscott, Holmes for the Holidays

quote: A universal truth that most mature women have learned, often the hard way.... When choosing a mate, keep in mind, only nature has the ability to turn sand into pearls. If the relationship isn't happy, healthy, or working, move on... unless of course you prefer sand.
author: K.E. Garvey

quote: Stop reliant on human effort. Seek divine power.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Pearls of  Wisdom: Great  mind
category: advice, christian-life, divine-self, encouragement, gods-grace, motivation, seeking-god, self-determination, self-worth, spirituality, strength, success, uplifting, you-can

quote: Let us, with songs of praise, embrace the sacred year.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Pearls of  Wisdom: Great  mind
category: advice, christian-life, daily-inspiration, grateful, inspiration, motivation, new-year, resolutions, spirituality, thankful-heart, uplifting

quote: You can just about always stand more 'n you think you can.
author: Texas Bix Bender

quote: There's a lot more to ridin' a horse than just sittin' in the saddle and lettin' yer feet hang down.
author: Texas Bix Bender, Don't Squat With Yer Spurs On!: A Cowboy's Guide to Life

quote: It is better to do little things with love than big things without love.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Pearls of  Wisdom: Great  mind
category: advice, community-service, doing, doing-the-right-thing, giving, giving-advice, helping-others, humanity, inspiration, love, sowing-deed, volunteering, work-ethics, work-hard, working, working-together

quote: When I make a mistake, all I need from you is correction. Some more advice won't hurt. Judge not.
author: DaVyshka

quote: What need of prompt or hint when it is open to yourself to discern what needs to be done - and, if you can see your way, to follow it with kind but undeviating intent. If you cannot see the way, hold back and consult your best advisors. if some other factors obstruct this advice, proceed on your present resources, but with cautious deliberations, keeping always to what seems just. Justice is the best aim, as any failure is in fact a failure of justice.A man following reason in all things combines relaxation with initiative, spark with composure.
author: Marcus Aurelius
category: advice, choices, help, justice, reason, uncertainty

quote: May your sacred star guide you every day of the New Year.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Pearls of  Wisdom: Great  mind
category: advice, christian-life, desires, dreams, every-day-life, faith, guidance, hope, inspiration, morning, motivate, new-day, new-year, new-year-s-resolutions, self-awareness, self-motivation, shine-bright, shine-your-star, stars, visions, wise-thoughts, wishes

quote: It takes a lot of courage to push through hard times. Never give up. Good things are coming your way.

quote: Here's my advice: don't put all your hope and faith into something that could suddenly and easily disappear. And honestly, that's almost anything. The only thing that will never go away, that will never fail you, is your faith in God.

If you try to force yourself to create an epic story, you will feel the ensuing drudgery quite acutely-- and worse, your readers will feel it too. Conversely, if you wait for the book that won't leave you alone until you finish it, your readers will feel that energy and it will make it difficult for them to put the book down until they have finished it!

quote: Who will teach me to write? a reader wanted to know.The page, the page, that eternal blankness, the blankness of eternity which you cover slowly, affirming time's scrawl as a right and your daring as necessity; the page, which you cover woodenly, ruining it, but asserting your freedom and power to act, acknowledging that you ruin everything you touch but touching it nevertheless, because acting is better than being here in mere opacity; the page, which you cover slowly with the crabbed thread of your gut; the page in the purity of its possibilities; the page of your death, against which you pit such flawed excellences as you can muster with all your life's strength: that page will teach you to write.

quote: Dear Future Daughter:1) When you’re at some party, chain smoking on the roof with some strange girl with blue hair and exorbitant large dark eyes, ask her about her day. I promise you, you won’t regret it. Often times you’ll find the strangest of people have the most captivating of stories to tell.2) Please, never mistake desire for love. Love will engulf your soul, whilst desire will emerge as acid, slowly making it’s way through your veins, gradually burning you from the inside out.3) No one is going to fucking save you, anything you’ve read or heard otherwise is bullshit.4) One day a boy is going to come along who’s touch feels like fire and who’s words taste like vanilla, when he leaves you, you will want to die. If you know anything at all, know that it is only temporary.5) Your mental health comes before school baby, always. If its midnight, and you have an exam the next day but your hands have been shaking for the past hour and a half and you’re not so sure you want to be alive anymore, pull out that carton of Ben and Jerry’s and afterwards, go the fuck to bed. So what if you get a 68% on the exam the next day? You took care of yourself and at the end of the day that will always come before a high test score. To hell with anyone who tells you differently.
author: Abbie Nielsen

quote: Advice"I must do as you do? Your way I ownIs a very good way, and still,There are sometimes two straight roads to a town,One over, one under the hill.You are treading the safe and the well-worn way,That the prudent choose each time;And you think me reckless and rash to-dayBecause I prefer to climb.Your path is the right one, and so is mine.We are not like peas in a pod,Compelled to lie in a certain line,Or else be scattered abroad.'T were a dull old world, methinks, my friend,If we all just went one way;Yet our paths will meet no doubt at the end,Though they lead apart today.You like the shade, and I like the sun;You like an even pace,I like to mix with the crowd and run,And then rest after the race.I like danger, and storm, and strife,You like a peaceful time;I like the passion and surge of life,You like its gentle rhyme.You like buttercups, dewy sweet,And crocuses, framed in snow;I like roses, born of the heat,And the red carnation's glow.I must live my life, not yours, my friend,For so it was written down;We must follow our given paths to the end,But I trust we shall meet--in town.
author: Ella Wheeler Wilcox

quote: Go, even though you love him.Go, even though he is kind and faithful and dear to you.Go, even though he's your best friend and you're his. Go, even though you can't imagine your life without him. Go, even though he adores you and your leaving will devastate him. Go, even though your friends will be disappointed or surprised or pissed off or all three. Go, even though you once said you would stay. Go, even though you're afraid of being alone. Go, even though you're sure no one will ever love you as well as he does. Go, even though there is nowhere to go.Go, even though you don't know exactly why you can't stay.Go, because you want to. Because wanting to leave is enough.

quote: To make matters worse, everyone she talks to has a different opinion about the nature of his problem and what she should do about it. Her clergyperson may tell her, “Love heals all difficulties. Give him your heart fully, and he will find the spirit of God.” Her therapist speaks a different language, saying, “He triggers strong reactions in you because he reminds you of your father, and you set things off in him because of his relationship with his mother. You each need to work on not pushing each other’s buttons.” A recovering alcoholic friend tells her, “He’s a rage addict. He controls you because he is terrified of his own fears. You need to get him into a twelve-step program.” Her brother may say to her, “He’s a good guy. I know he loses his temper with you sometimes—he does have a short fuse—but you’re no prize yourself with that mouth of yours. You two need to work it out, for the good of the children.” And then, to crown her increasing confusion, she may hear from her mother, or her child’s schoolteacher, or her best friend: “He’s mean and crazy, and he’ll never change. All he wants is to hurt you. Leave him now before he does something even worse.” All of these people are trying to help, and they are all talking about the same abuser. But he looks different from each angle of view.
author: Lundy Bancroft, Why Does He Do That?: Inside the Minds of Angry and Controlling Men
category: abuse, abused-women, abusive-men, abusive-partner, abusive-partners, abusive-relationship, abusive-relationships, advice, domestic-abuse, domestic-violence, emotional-abuse, mental-abuse, psychological-abuse, psychotherapy

quote: I remembered what Dad said once, that some people have all of life's answers worked out the day they're born and there's no use trying to teach them anything new. quote: It is good to brush your teeth when you are angry, because you brush harder and do a better job.
author: Lemony Snicket, Who Could That Be at This Hour?

quote: Be direct and sure of the path you tread, but not so sure that you pass the paths better suited to your feet, brother.
author: Erica Cameron, Sing Sweet Nightingale

quote: And honey no matter how bad it hurts, never forget that something about you made him once fall in love. Don't lose that.
author: Lucy Whitlock

quote: I guess, my advice would be the following: stay calm and do not let the panic seize you.
author: Kateryna Kei, Raven Boy
category: advice, fantasy, fantasy-books, fantasy-fiction, fantasy-series, fantasy-young-adult, inspirational, life, life-lessons, raven-boy, war, wisdom

quote: Don’t be stupider than you need to be, I remind myself. Remember Calease? The last glowing girl you talked to tried to kill you.
author: Erica Cameron, Sing Sweet Nightingale
category: advice, calease, hudson-vincent, humor, sing-sweet-nightingale, the-dream-war-saga

quote: You may tell yourself a hundred times that you love someone more than yourself, more than your life and that you would do anything to be with that person even if the person does not care about you as much as you care for that person, or maybe even if you do not exist for that person at all. But, the fact is - there is always a little voice inside your head asking you to stop, turn around and walk away. The sensible thing to do would be to heed to that voice.
author: Arti Honrao

quote: Change what you can, darlin'. That's my best advice.
author: Dee Williams

quote: A day of worry is more exhausting than a week of work.
author: John Lubbock, The Use Of Life

quote: Control yourself, it is not worth it. You will regret your rudeness afterwards, your sensitive nature will be troubled
author: Leila Aboulela, Minaret

quote: In matters of religion and matrimony I never give advice, because I will not have anybody's torments in this world or the next laid to my charge.
author: Philip Dormer Stanhope

quote: Oliver has stated many times his dislike of hearing advice from his younger sister, so it is his own fault if he has not got sense enough to see which way the wind is blowing.
author: Patricia C. Wrede, Sorcery & Cecelia: or The Enchanted Chocolate Pot
category: advice, brothers, common-sense, funny, ignored, siblings, stupidity

quote: My advice to you, my violent friend, is to seek out gold and sit on it.
author: John Gardner, Grendel

quote: You can never take anything personally. Just a story. It’s not their fault they want to kick you and it’s certainly not yours. It’s just the way things are. Sometimes you need to hear the worst, so you have no fear in what you do and learn to work around the what-have-you.
author: Initially NO, Percipience: Outside the Range of Understood Sense
category: advice, fault, hearing-the-worst, kind, learning-curve, taking-things-personally, working-around

quote: I would never advise shooing away a good idea.
author: Phoebe Stone, Romeo Blue
category: advice, british, bye-bye, good, hope, ideas, shoo, tea

quote: make only your trust in God
author: His author must surely finish his work. Hold on!

quote: The Cream Does NOT Always Rise To The Top! There is a serious misconception, misconnection and mistake in this idea of thinking.
author: Loren Weisman
category: advice, cream-rising-to-the-top, misconceptions, misconnection, music-business-quotes, thinking

quote: ...as I am not fond of giving advice,having seldom seen it taken
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Being honest to yourself is the smartest you can ever do.Do no allow the words of others to lead you to a road of confussion, follow your heart beat.
author: Osunsakin Adewale

quote: In second grade my second love wrote "I love you" on a scrap of paper and dropped it on my desk as he passed by. He was very shy and sullen. When he moved to another school at the end of the term, I was heartsick. I thought about him all summer. But I learned then that we do outgrow people and our tastes do change. One should not marry until one is older. At least ten.
author: Jane Russell, Jane Russell: My Path and My Detours: An Autobiography

quote: Don't change for me, I'll not change for you.I don't deserve it, you don't deserve it.﻿
author: Leutrim Shabani

quote: You can't lead when you have not been loaded with the skills of immagination.
author: oladosu feyikogbon
category: advice, faith, feyikogbon, humor, inspirational, lead, life, live, quote-i-love, skills, statics, what-to-do

quote: when the life gives you lemon, simply sell them and buy something sweet like chocolate
author: samuel ariel parker

quote: The advice he reads in Ann Landers – good advice as long as you don’t need it, perfectly sensible as long as you don’t have any use for it.
author: Robert Hellenga, Philosophy Made Simple

quote: All the external adoration, respect and adulation in the world, can't drown out the internal voices that tell us, we are not good enough and unworthy of; happiness, love and an abundant life. When we need others to tell us we're amazing, worthy and lovable, in order to feel good about ourselves, it is never enough. It goes into the bottomless pit where our inherent self-worth should be. It may feel like we are reaching out to receive love, but in actuality, we are seeking external noise to help drown out our negative core beliefs.
author: Jaeda DeWalt
category: advice, breaking-up, jaeda-dewalt, letting-go, love, moving-on, relationships, self-worth

quote: I cannot give any scientist of any age better advice than this: the intensity of the conviction that a hypothesis is true has no bearing on whether it is true or not.
author: Peter Medawar, Advice To A Young Scientist
category: advice, conviction, hypothesis, science, scientist, wishful-thinking

quote: The best way in the world for breaking up a writer's block is to write a lot.
author: John Gardner, On Becoming a Novelist

quote: I will call bullshit on that so many times that the word bullshit will lose all meaning. -Milo
author: Cora Carmack, Faking It

quote: Having bad experiences sometimes helps; it makes it clearer what it is youshould be doing. I know that sounds very Pollyannaish but it’s true. People who have had only good experiences aren’t very interesting. They may be content, and happy after a fashion, but they aren’t very deep. It may seem a misfortune now, and it makes things difficult, but well—it’s easy to feel all the happy, simple stuff. Not that happiness is necessarily simple. But I don’t think you’re going to have a life like that, and I think you’ll be the better for it. The difficult thing is to not be overwhelmed by the bad patches. You mustn’t let them defeat you. You must see them as a gift—a cruel gift, but a gift nonetheless.
author: Peter Cameron, Someday This Pain Will Be Useful to You
category: advice, inspirational, inspirations, life, life-lessons, problems

quote: There is nothing which we receive with so much reluctance as advice.
author: Joseph Addison

quote: Write down what your reader needs, no more, no less. Reading should be textured, but not obscure. Henry James could make an entire paragraph out of a single sentence. The reader is completely sensory deprived of the story until the words show the way. If a reader were practiced, then James’ prose could be followed and appreciated for its economy and elegance.
author: Christopher T. Garry

quote: To be a successful general one must be prayful, faithful and work hard
author: Osunsakin Adewale

quote: Writing is a profession that has no real career structure and your best advice when you hit a difficulty is probably going to come from another writer one or two rungs on the career ladder ahead of you.
author: Sara Sheridan
category: advice, career, career-ladder, difficulty, job, profession, support, writers, writing

quote: Theoretically there's no reason one should get [writer's block], if one understands that writing, after all, is only writing, neither something one ought to feel deeply guilty about nor something one ought to be inordinately proud of.
author: John Gardner, On Becoming a Novelist
category: advice, novel-writing, tips, writer-s-block, writing, writing-advice

quote: It does not take God one second to re-write your ugly past .
author: Osunsakin Adewale

quote: You can make it right, just faith the future and work towards it
author: oladosu feyikogbon

quote: A lillion miles of journey starts with a foot stamp
author: oladosu feyikogbon

quote: whenthings turns upside down, think it over and let new come apace
author: oladosu feyikogbon
category: advice, confusion, education, feyikogbon, inspirational, life, victory, winning

quote: Your yesterday does not really matter , what matter most is the days to come .
author: Osunsakin Adewale

quote: This is not a meritocracy.
author: Sallie Tisdale, Talk Dirty to Me

quote: We've got this heat going on, that's all. If it's all the same to you, I'd rather not go into that end ofthings.""Oh, it's all the same to me. You're both adults and you got two working brains between you. Bothof you were raised right, so what you do is your own business. Next time, though, lock the damn doorfirst.
author: Nora Roberts, The Villa

quote: Live as long as you want, but you must die; love whatever you want, but you will become separated from it; and do what you want, but you will be repaid for it!
author: حجة الإسلام أبو حامد محمد الغزالي, Al-Ghazali's Letter to a Disciple

quote: Erase the parts that make me unhappy. I guess that means emphasizing the parts that do.
author: Cassie Mae, How to Date a Nerd

quote: Whatever you can do, or dream you can, begin it.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: My best advice is to first write for yourself and stay in your story and just pour all of your good stuff and bad stuff into it. By 'stuff,' I mean all the experiences and pleasures and little hurts that make up a life. Because even (and especially) the really hard experiences are worth having, if you can channel those emotions into something beautiful.
author: Jenny Han
category: advice, advice-for-writers, bad-stuff, good-stuff, hurts, little-hurts

quote: It seems that many of us have the goal of making other people conform to our desires and expectations, whether or not we would admit to such a thing. We see this especially in parents who get upset because their children don’t conform to their expectations, but instead follow a pattern of development that is unique and individual. We often use language with peers and colleagues that encourages them to change their ways of doing things to our ways of doing things: “You should” and “You ought to” are usually presented as advice, but in the end they really are about changing someone else’s ways of doing things. And we may offer this “advice” in a spirit of love and helpfulness, but we can be much more helpful when we help them to find their own ways of changing things.
