author: Maya Angelou

quote: Life is a lesson that must never be taken for granted.
author: Debra Roinestad, Protected by the Light: A Spiritual Memoir

quote: If you didn't make me your world, why should I make you mine?
author: Jenna Alatari

quote: The only thing that I know that truly heals people is unconditional love.
author: R.J. Palacio

quote: Healing is not always about completely healing but sometimes just lessening of the pain.
author: Matthew Donnelly

quote: It is hard to say YES when you cannot say NO. Say NO a lot more. Mean it. Watch how saying YES then becomes easier.
author: Gary K. Smith, The Mathematics of Sorrow: A Heart-based Model That Turns Sorrow Into A Gift

quote: The absolute easiest thing to do is spend time, as often as one can, in tranquil or majestic nature. Look at butterflies. Walk barefoot in the sand. Put your feet in a clean, bubbling stream. Walk in a city park and feed the pigeons. Anything. Get out and take a walk.
author: Gary K. Smith, The Mathematics of Sorrow: A Heart-based Model That Turns Sorrow Into A Gift

quote: It’s also important to realize that healing is something we receive and keep by faith.
author: Paul Silway, Heaven I - Paradise: The City and Throne

quote: Sorrow is specific. Sorrow is vibrational. Sorrow is the state of depressed dimensional fields in and around the heart region. So actually, what is being said here is that there comes a time when an individual cannot love enough to transmute certain experience. Certain experiences are so challenging that the individual’s heart region depresses. If one can transmute shocks to the heart, and regain or hold heart balance, then one understands the “mathematics of sorrow” at that dimensional spectrum.
author: Gary K. Smith, The Mathematics of Sorrow: A Heart-based Model That Turns Sorrow Into A Gift

quote: Every person is driven to self-deceive, simply to get out of the discomfort of the truth. The best relationships are with people who will not let you be blind. They reveal your hidden strengths and your concealed wounds.
author: Vironika Tugaleva
category: healing, love, relationships, self-awareness, self-deception, soul-mates, soulmate, strengths, wounds

quote: God (Love) can heal anything. Your job is to give permission. It takes a lotof trust.
author: Mabel Katz, The Easiest Way to Understanding Ho'oponopono
category: answer, easiest, god, healing, hooponopono, mabel, question, understanding, way

quote: Gloria put a bowl of stew in Peter's hands. "Eat," she said.Peter raised the spoon to his lips. He chewed. He swallowed.It had been a long time since he had eaten anything besides tiny fish and old bread.And so when Peter had his first bite of stew, it overwhelmed him. The warmth of it, the richness of it, knocked him backward; it was as if a gentle hand had pushed him when he was not expecting it. Everything he had lost came flooding back: the garden, his father, his mother, his sister, the promises that he had made and could not keep."What's this?" said Gloria Matienne. "The boy is crying.""Shhh," said Leo. He put his hand on Peter's shoulder. "Shhh. Don't worry, Peter. Everything will be good. All will be well. We will do together whatever it is that needs to be done. But for now, you must eat."Peter nodded. He raised his spoon. Again he chewed and swallowed, and again he was overcome. He could not help it. He could not stop the tears; they flowed down his cheeks and into the bowl. "It is a very good stew, Madam Matienne. he managed to say. "Truly, it is an excellent stew.
author: Kate DiCamillo, The Magician's Elephant

quote: We dream of the future, to distract ourselves from the present, in order to forget the past.Heal the past, live in the present and don’t rush to the future. Life is a journey and it will all be over before you know it.
author: L.J. Vanier

quote: If you don't believe something can be done, at least don't stand in the way of someone else doing it!
author: Ed Strachar

quote: Healing belongs to you. It belongs to you because sickness is of the enemy. It belongs to you because you are a spiritual child of Abraham. It belongs to you because sickness is a curse and Christ has redeemed you from the curse of the law.
author: Paul Silway, Heaven I - Paradise: The City and Throne

quote: With God’s help in the grasp of addiction you’ll find the truth. When we understand this and its purity, then true healing can begin.
author: Ron Baratono

quote: Recovery can take place only within then context of relationships
author: it cannot occur in isolation.
category: Judith Lewis Herman, Trauma and Recovery: The Aftermath of Violence - From Domestic Abuse to Political Terror

quote: Recovery can take place only within then context of relationships; it cannot occur in isolation. In her renewed connection with other people, the survivor re-creates the psychological facilities that were damaged or deformed by the traumatic experience. These faculties include the basic operations of trust, autonomy, initiative, competence, identity, and intimacy.Just as these capabilities are formed in relationships with other people, they must be reformed in such relationships.The first principle of recovery is empowerment of the survivor. She must be the author and arbiter of her own recovery. Others may offer advice, support, assistance, affection, and care, but not cure.Many benevolent and well-intentioned attempts to assist the survivor founder because this basic principle of empowerment is not observed. No intervention that takes power away from the survivor can possibly foster her recovery, no matter how much it appears to be in her immediate best interest.
author: Judith Lewis Herman, Trauma and Recovery: The Aftermath of Violence - From Domestic Abuse to Political Terror
category: abuse, child-sexual-abuse, complex-ptsd, complex-trauma, healing, healthy-relationships, isolation, ptsd, rape, recovery, relationships, sexual-abuse, survivor, trauma

quote: Fear of breaking family loyalty is one of the greatest stumbling blockages to recovery. Yet, until we admit certain things we would rather excuse or deny, we cannot truly begin to put the past in the past, and leave it there once and for all. Unless we do that, we cannot even begin to think of having a future that is fully ours, untethered to the past, and we will be destined to repeat it.
author: Ronald Allen Schulz
category: abuse, child-abuse, denial, dysfunctional-family, emotional-abuse, healing, healthy-relationships, mental-illness, recovery, sexual-abuse, toxic-family

quote: You might think that nobody’s insides are as messy as your insides. That’s an optical delusion. You only see other people’s outsides – never their insides. So you can’t possibly know.
author: Deborah Pardes, Climbing Out from Under: A Handbook for Heartbreak

quote: Gratitude is a harbinger of healing, the first robin of spring.
author: Joyce Wycoff

quote: …all that goes under the name of science is not necessarily scientific, and that all that goes under the name of health-care will not necessarily care for your health.
author: Neville Mandy

quote: O Lord, Thy Word, heals my wounds.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!
category: christian-life, god, healing, health, inner-strength, spirituality

quote: Hope is firm belief.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!
category: adversity, christian, despair, faith, fighting-spirit, happiness, healing, hope, inner-strength, joy, life, motivational, self-help

quote: Christians who fail also avoid other Christians, especially when they are feeling bad and guilty in the midst of their failure. It's sad to see this dynamic of the law happen in the church and then see the opposite happen in Twelve Step groups. In these recovery groups, people are taught that the very first thing to do when you fail is to call someone in the group and get to a meeting. They are taught to "run to grace," as it were, to turn immediately to their higher power and their support system. The sad part is that this theology is more biblical than what is practices in many Christian environments, where people in failure run from instead of to God and the people they need.
author: Henry Cloud

quote: It hurts because He is treating your spiritual disease, just as a good medical practitioner does for his patients.
author: Steven Chopade

quote: You only live once this time around ... have no fear, take every chance, live, laugh, love.
author: Rosanne Lombardo Heaton, TIME Heals

quote: This MomentThis straining, messy, awful,moment in time Is perfect. Push aside your agenda for a second and you’ll find perfection bursting out of its confines.This moment brings truth,illuminates weaknesses,and builds power and wisdomto make us stronger.There are numerous signs, here and now,that teach so profoundly,that validate the strengths we hold inside,that let us know who we really loveand what we need to say.If we can make ourselves look at these signs,at the whole picture, at how it fits together, at where our path is leading, we might discover how to turn our direction,So this moment can rise upriding a cloud of joy,and heal.
author: JV Connors

quote: In the world we live in, you will be warned ironically when you kill yourself, but will be killed literally when you heal yourself
author: Goitsemang Mvula

quote: It is often amidst the chaos in our life that we finally find the reason for our existence.
author: Divya Nambiar

quote: Only if I heal, can you heal. Only if you heal, can I heal. Otherwise, we would continue to scar each other.
author: Srividya Srinivasan

quote: It's frustrating when our best efforts to help people fail. But if we could see life through their weary eyes and experience their trials with the same frayed emotions, we might understand why.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: assisting, charity, empathy, healing, helping, helping-others, mental-illness, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, sympathy, understanding

quote: And now the birds were singing overhead, and there was a soft rustling in the undergrowth, and all the sounds of the forest that showed that life was still being lived blended with the souls of the dead in a woodland requiem. The whole forest now sang for Granny Weatherwax.
author: Terry Pratchett

quote: Healing from an eating disorder is a personal journey—the medicine is whatever reminds you that you do in fact want to live, and that you are worthy and capable of love.
author: Shannon Kopp, Pound for Pound: A Story of One Woman's Recovery and the Shelter Dogs Who Loved Her Back to Life

quote: Time & distance does wonders for healing & rejuvenating your soul.
author: April Mae Monterrosa
category: distance, healing, moving-on, rejuvenating, self-growth, time

quote: If someone thinks you can help or heal them, and you think you can’t, choose their faith over your doubt.
author: Alan Cohen

quote: A very smart woman once told me that anger can feel like a life buoy, like it's the only thing keeping you afloat, but that in order to heal you have to let go.
author: Kimberly Belle, The Ones We Trust

quote: God wants to take us step by step to free us from any unhealthy distractions. Don't expect other people to change, nor should we live in the past. He understands our hearts. We are not afraid to go forward because we are his children. Part of healing is understanding the past including the good and bad things
author: Phil Mitchell, A Bright New Morning: An American Story

quote: Our bodies are our vehicles of life. They are ours to take care of. If we aren’t taking care of them, they show signs of stress and wear. If we are taking care of our bodies, they show signs of healing and resiliency. A healthy body is an inspired body, and an inspired body is a happy body.
author: Elaina Marie, Happiness is Overrated - Live the Inspired Life Instead

quote: Healing from childhood abuse is not going mad, it is going sane.
author: Jan  Hawkins, Person-Centred Practice: The BAPCA Reader

quote: Tchingis, if you determine this is to be so, who can withstand you? You are poetry after an ugly day, and heal wounds I didn't know I had.
author: Bryn  Hammond, Amgalant Two: Tribal Brawls

quote: To love a place is not enough. We must find ways to heal it.
author: Robin Wall Kimmerer, Braiding Sweetgrass: Indigenous Wisdom, Scientific Knowledge, and the Teachings of Plants

quote: To accept responsibility for your own feelings, your own triggers, and your own experience does not mean to stop communicating with others about how their words and actions affect you. You can own your emotions by not blaming others, and still give the people in your life gentle, loving feedback about how they can treat you in a way that helps your healing and happiness. Creating safe spaces is an interdependent process. It's not ever all about you and it's not ever all about the other person. It's about you coming together and working on the dynamics of your relationship together, taking responsibility for your own part and doing what you can to contribute to the well-being of the other.
author: Vironika Tugaleva
category: blame, healing, hppiness, interdependence, relationships, responsibility, soulmates, together, well-being

quote: A turquoise given by a loving hand carries with it happiness and good fortune."Arabic proverb
author: Judy Hall, 101 Power Crystals: The Ultimate Guide to Magical Crystals, Gems, and Stones for Healing and Transformation

quote: Have you ever been by yourself with no distractions? No radio, no TV, no internet, no mobile. Have you every been yourself in complete and utter silence? With no expectations and nothing else to do?Silence heals.
author: Ana Ortega

quote: The first step to healing is to make peace with your scars
author: Evy Michaels

quote: Your path is illuminated by a road-map of stars. I am here to guide you!
author: Ambika Devi
category: astrological, astrology, celestial, curative, elixir, guidance, healing, planetary

quote: In the same way, filling a cavity restores to the tooth its natural function of chewing. Healing does not transcend our nature; it respects it.
author: J. Budziszewski, What We Can't Not Know: A Guide

quote: Things can’t mend without being broken.
author: A.J. Compton, The Counting-Downers

quote: Happy, Healthy, Wealthy, and Wise, for the rest of our days till the end of our lives.
author: J. Lee Roberts

quote: When your energy is not in present time, you don't have the energy to fuel your body-mind. To be able to heal your body, you need to have a large percentage of your energy in present time. This explains partially why some people are able to heal themselves quickly and others are not.
author: Candess M. Campbell, 12 Weeks to Self-Healing: Transforming Pain Through Energy Medicine

quote: You came into my life and you healed me. You made me feel alive again.
author: Jay McLean, More Than Forever

quote: Let the kindness and the raw, aching beauty of the universe shatter you over and over again. find peace in the knowledge that your whole is composed of the sum of all of your beautifully broken pieces. because breaking is becoming.
author: Jeanette LeBlanc

quote: Working with plants will teach you all other social commitments in a soothing way...
author: Karthikeyan V

quote: Our love would be solace, companionship, and the mending of wounds.
author: Amy Tan, The Valley of Amazement

quote: We have all been hurt at some point in our lives, from a spouse, a friend, an employer, a co-worker,a pastor and sometimes the wounds are so deep we wonder if they will ever heal.
author: Michael Richard Stosic, Thirty-Nine Days

quote: He held out his arms and I ran to embrace him. It wasn’t that I couldn’t feel my sorrows anymore, it was as if they were never there. I felt safe, and loved. There were no words exchanged, we just held each other.
author: Michael Brent Jones, A Hole in Heaven's Gate
category: faith, god, healing, hope, hug, love, safety, sorrow

quote: ....not only does the devil hate man, but he also has a special hatred for women and the wombs of women; for through the wombs of women come offspring who bring forth the purposes and intents of God here on earth.
author: Theresa Pecku-Laryea, Hannah's Song

quote: Vulnerability is what heals us.
author: Denny Morales

quote: May you find comfort by reading and mediation on God’s word.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Pearls of  Wisdom: Great  mind
category: comfort, despair, disappointment, emotional, gods-power, gods-word, healing, holy-bible, holy-writings, life, mediation, peace, quotes, read, reading-habits, scriptures, seekers-of-fate, spiritual-life, strength-through-adversity

quote: When you get your heart broken, other people can help you pick the pieces up, but only you can glue the pieces back together.
author: Sam Madison, The Heartbroken Heartbreaker

quote: When we run, hide and try to deny our trauma the little boy or girl within comes back to seek validation, healing and peace.
author: Cecibel Contreras

quote: Be at peace with yourself and with all men.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Pearls of  Wisdom: Great  mind
category: christian-quotes, faith-quotes, healing, hope-and-despair, humanity-and-society, humanity-quotes, inner-peace, joyful-living-quotes, peace, peace-quote, people-quotes, positive-quotes, you-life, yourself

quote: Your eyes see me in ways the mirror never could.
author: Jenim Dibie

quote: How do you survive the survivor?
author: Kyo Maclear, Stray Love

quote: It occurs to me that if I don’t sort myself out soon I will die of meaninglessness. That is the price of avoiding the things I find troubling.
author: Kyo Maclear, Stray Love

quote: May the Lord increase your strength.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Pearls of  Wisdom: Great  mind
category: belief-quotes, believe-in-yourself, bible-quotes, christian-quotes, faith-quotes, fighting-spirit, god, healing, hopeful-and-encouraging, inner-strength-quotes, jesus-christ, lailah, overcomer-quotes, positive-thoughts, praying-quotes, self-determination, self-help-quotes, self-motivation-quotes, warrior

quote: Hang on! God will strength in any act of your pursuit.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Pearls of  Wisdom: Great  mind
category: character-quote, despair, difficult-times-quotes, dont-give-up, dont-quit-quotes, dreams-inspirational, educational-philosophy, educational-quotes, fighting-spirit, god, god-s-grace, hardtimes-quotes, healing, hope, inspirational-quotes, knowledge-of-self, never-give-up, overcomer-quotes, persistence-quotes, pursue-quotes, pursuit, pursuit-of-goals, religion-and-philosophy, religious-faith, self-help-quotes, strength-quotes, strength-through-adversity, survival-instinct, surviving-instinct, wise-quotes

quote: Let your body move. It will give voice to a language that can heal.
author: Gina Greenlee, Postcards and Pearls: Life Lessons from Solo Moments on the Road

quote: I was coming together...limb by limb, after being brokenfor an infinity.
author: Sanober  Khan, A touch, a tear, a tempest
category: broken, coming-together, heal, healing, infinity, pieces, poetry, poetry-quotes

quote: You know what's sexy? A person who's been through a life challenge, and comes out with insights, more depth, and a fiery passion to face forward, forward, forward!
author: Karen Salmansohn, Instant Happy Journal: 365 Days of Inspiration, Gratitude, and Joy

quote: If writers write not just with paper and ink or a word processor but with their own life's blood, then I think something like this is perhaps always the case. A book you write out of the depths of who you are, like a dream you dream out of those same depths, is entirely your own creation. All the words your characters speak are words that you alone have put into their mouths, just as every situation they become involved in is one that you alone have concocted for them. But it seems to me that nonetheless that a book you write, like a dream you dream, can have more healing and truth and wisdom in it at least for yourself than you feel in any way responsible for.
author: Frederick Buechner, Telling Secrets

quote: Give yourself a break to avoid a breakdown.
author: Karen Salmansohn, Bounce Back Book

quote: Hope kept us alive in the midst of the turbulence.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Pearls of  Wisdom: Great  mind
category: alive-to-see-today, challenges-quotes, despair-and-attitude, despair-hope, determination-quotes, determined-spirit, difficult-times, difficulties-of-life, encourage-yourself, encouragement-quotes, healing, healing-the-past, hope-and-despair, hope-and-healing, hope-and-life, hopeful-and-encouraging, hopeful-people, hopeful-quotes, inspirational-quotes, living-well, living-your-best-life, obstacles-quotes, overcomer-quotes, overcoming-adversity, persistence-quotes, positive-mindset, positive-thinking-quotes, storms-of-life, stormy-day, survival-instinct, surviving-life, turbulence

quote: Throw out old clothes and shoes, and train your brain to get rid of old thoughts and ideas.
author: Karen Salmansohn, Bounce Back Book

quote: Trying to find answers to why and how my life got into such a dismal mess, I sought answers in the scriptures, in religion and philosophy, but it only confused me further. Stories, on the other hand, helped me cope, heal and recover.
author: Indu Muralidharan, The Reengineers

quote: Time not only heals, time reveals
author: Karen Salmansohn, Bounce Back Book

quote: Believe in what makes you Healthy, because everything else is just garbage.
author: Gary   Hopkins
category: common-sense, emotional-health, emotional-intelligence, healing, health, placebo, self-awareness, self-empowerment

quote: The ultimate relationship is within thyself, knowing that all other relationships are a projection or a reflection of our ability or inability to love.
author: Erin Fall Haskell
category: ability, attitude, communication, healing, love, marriage, positivity, practice, relationships, truth

quote: Silence heals.
author: Nadun Lokuliyanage

quote: A Broken Record can still play the best soundtrack. Broken can be beautiful when you allow God work on you.
author: Kemi Sogunle
category: broken, broken-heart, broken-heart-quotes, brokenness, healing, inspiration, inspirational, inspirational-quotes

quote: Tears are good for you," Raphael said. When she opened her eyes back up, he knelt down. His large frame seemed to make the room shrink. His face was almost level with hers as his eyes met Emma's. "They are a gift from the Creator to his creation. Tears release endorphins in the mind that help sooth and comfort. They cleanse the eyes and relieve stress, thereby lowering blood pressure and taking strain off of the heart. He created you with tears and nothing he created is bad. Those tears you are holding in are necessary, Emma. Let them fall, let them heal, and let them remind you with each one that you are not alone.
author: Quinn Loftis, Dream of Me
category: angels, creation, creator, cry, crying, god-s-plan, healing, healing-abuse, tears, tears-crying

quote: It's not only the event itself, but the way we explain it to ourselves that causes depression.
author: Karen Salmansohn, Bounce Back Book

quote: Moses, without any mercy, breaks all bruised reeds, and quenches all smoking flax. For the law requires personal, perpetual and perfect obedience from the heart, and that under a most terrible curse, but gives no strength. It is a severe task master, like Pharaoh's, requiring the whole tale ofbricks and yet giving no straw. Christ comes with blessing after blessing, even upon those whom Moses had cursed, and with healing balm for those wounds which Moses had made.
author: Richard Sibbes, The Bruised Reed

quote: feeling means your dealing means your healing
author: Karen Salmansohn

quote: Write a complaint letter. Then answer it.
author: Karen Salmansohn, Bounce Back Book

quote: The pain you endure today will lead to a better tomorrow. Don't dwell so much on the pain but focus on the lessons learned. There in lies your strength to rise above all odds. Your best is yet to come.
author: Kemi Sogunle
category: endurance, healing, healing-from-the-past, inspiration, inspirational, inspirational-quotes, life-lessons, pain

quote: When you discover the difference between consciousness and the brain, you will discover yourself.
author: Jenna Alatari
category: consciousness, healing, healing-the-emotional-self, inspirational, spiritual, spiritual-awakening, spirituality

quote: Blessed be His name that He has arranged that one Person of the Sacred Trinity should undertake this office of Comforter, for no man could ever perform its duties. We might as well hope to be the Savior as to be the Comforter of the heartbroken!
author: Charles Haddon Spurgeon

quote: Nature in her green, tranquil woods heals and soothes all affliction,’ wrote John Muir. ‘Earth hath no sorrows that earth cannot heal.’ Now I knew this for what it was: a beguiling but dangerous lie. I was furious with myself and my own conscious certainty that t his was the cure I needed. Hands are for other humans to hold. They should not be reserved exclusively as perches for hawks. And the wild is not a panacea for the human soul; too much in the air can corrode it to nothing.
author: Helen Macdonald, H is for Hawk

quote: I have been hurt so bad and I still love so hard, I admire my heart for that.
author: Alexandra Elle, Words from a Wanderer

quote: I am facing a challenge, I am not facing defeat. Remember this.
author: Nikki Rowe
category: challenge, comeback, empowerment, fearless, healing, injury

quote: Your darkest moments are not meant to be swept under the carpet, hidden from the world in the silent pursuit of perfection. The darkness you've overcome is your ticket into leadership. It's what you're meant to light up in the world.
author: Vironika Tugaleva
category: dark-moments, darkness, healing, leadership, perfectionism, stories, telling-stories

quote: How everyone is struggling for something. Trying to keep the balance. Struggling to find their way back. Doing the best they can with what they've been dealt. Staying in place, doing anything to keep from sinking. To keep from rising. Until something changes. Like a day at school, a friend for lunch, someone standing up for you. And the choice to feel. Standing before you. Realizing what part is yours. What you can and can't do. Who you are. Who you are meant to be. More than the sum of all your broken parts.
author: Ash Parsons, Still Waters
category: abuse, change, choices, finding-oneself, harship, healing, hope, life, struggles, wisdom

quote: At the end of the day, what matters most is not what tore you apart but the love than binds and heals your heart.
author: Kemi Sogunle
category: healing, healing-from-the-past, life, life-lessons, love, love-quotes, love-quotes-for-heartbreak, moving-forward, moving-forward-in-life, moving-forward-quotes, restoration

quote: To protect the innocent, to avoid being one of Burke's good men who do nothing, you have to accept permanent scars that cincture the heart and traumas of the mind that occasionally reopen to weep again.
author: Dean Koontz, Odd Hours

quote: I decided to devote my life to telling my story because I felt that having survived I owe something to the world and anyone who has endured the pain, the isolation and the betrayal of family members.Though I no longer live in silence, I continued to carry the pain and the memories. This is something that will always be part of me but I choose not to be defined by this crime. I choose to give hope and I want survivors to know that they're not alone. I want children to have the opportunity to be happy, safe and protected from sexual abuse.
author: Cecibel Contreras

quote: I have been hurt so bad but I still love so hard, I admire my heart for that.
author: Alexandra Elle

quote: When you feel that unpleasant darkness invading your mind, read this book and these stories will help you return to the light and warmth of life.
author: Indu Muralidharan, The Reengineers

quote: getting angry and harbouring bitterness doesn’t help anybody, least of all the angry bitter person.
author: Jane Wilson-Howarth, Snowfed Waters

quote: Love is the most powerful healing energy. Everything you do with love spreads healing. So feel it,be it, and spread it.
author: Abhishek Kumar, Stardust Family - We Are One!
category: abhishek-kumar, energy, heal-the-earth, heal-the-planet, healing, love, spread-love, stardust-family, stardustak

quote: I have said so many times to many people on the spiritual path, 'You must be strong in yourself to help others. People who are in the emotional sea need someone who can pull them out, not someone who gets in with them and gets dragged away by the tidal wave of human emotions. We have to become emotional lifeguards.
author: Gordon Smith

quote: We are all part of something magnificent.
author: Jenna Alatari

quote: A scar isn't about the injury, it's about the healing.
author: Daniel José Older, Salsa Nocturna: Stories

quote: It wasn’t only his city that was healing, Raphael thought, his eyes catching the refracted light that betrayed Aodhan’s presence in the sky; his people were, too. And it had all begun with a single, vulnerable mortal who did not accept that to be an archangel was to be always right.
author: Nalini Singh, Archangel's Shadows

quote: We have to walk by faith to possess all that is duly ours.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!
category: adversity-quotes, advice-quotes, believe-and-achieve, believe-and-you-shall-receive, believers, christian-living, christians-self-help, destiny-and-attitude, destiny-quotes, determined-spirit, emotional-pain, encourage-yourself, encouragement-quotes, endurance-and-attitude, endurance-quotes, endure, enduring-hardships, faith-in-god, faith-quotes, fate-destiny, god, healing, healing-the-past, hope-and-healing, hope-and-life, hurt-feelings, inspirational-quotes, motivational-quotes, mystery-of-life, pain, painful, positive-thoughts, possession, religion-christianity, religion-spirituality, restoration, self-belief, self-help, wise-sayings

quote: It may hurt today, but it will get better. Time passes, and people forget. It won't be long before you'll be able to look back on everything that happened today and laugh.
author: Trudi Trueit, Julep O'Toole: Confessions of a Middle Child

quote: ...I felt the wall between the world of secrets and the real world start to collapse. I felt the girls from the portrait becoming us and us becoming them...
author: Carol Rifka Brunt, Tell the Wolves I'm Home

quote: To show you all my scars, is not to tell you that this Dunya would always leave you wounded, and bruised, and on knees, but to show you that see, healing is always possible. Healing is easy. Healing is beautiful.
author: Khadija Rupa
category: beautiful, bruised, healing, khadija-rupa-quotes, lifequotes, scars, wounded

quote: It's not about changing "them," it's about healing YOU.
author: Shannon Tanner, Worthy: The POWER of Wholeness

quote: Hold fast to your faith.Keep your hope in the Lord.Embrace the love of God.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!
category: answers-to-prayers, believers, christian, christian-living, christianity, despair, disappointment, empowering-quotes, encourage-yourself, encouragement-and-attitude, encouragement-quotes, endurance-and-attitude, endurance-quotes, faith-in-god, faith-quotes, faith-strength, god, god-s-promises, healing, hope-and-despair, hope-quotes, hope-through-struggles, hopeful-and-encouraging, hopeful-quotes, inspired-life, inspired-quotes, inspiring-quotes, inspiring-quotes-on-life, joy-of-life, joyful-living-quotes, joyful-quotes-thankful, love, love-quotes, overcomer-quotes, overcoming-adversity, overcoming-challenges, pain, painful-memories, prayer-quotes, prayerful-habits, religion-quote, religion-spirituality, religious-faith, religious-quote, struggle-for-life, struggle-quotes, struggle-strength-character, time-travel

quote: ...the heart is a muscle like any other. Tearing it down is the only way to make it stronger.
author: Sarah Skilton, Bruised

quote: They called her witch because she knew how to heal herself.
author: Té V. Smith, Here We Are, Reflections of A God Gone Mad

quote: The most beautiful, amazing and inevitable fact about life- Everything has a natural healing process.
author: Sanober  Khan
category: amazing, comforting, encouragement, facts-of-life, heal, healing, life-quotes, motivational, nurturing, poetry-quotes, soulful, wisdom

quote: Often times, people don't realize how much their childhood still affects them when they are an adult. Or other people don’t realize the affect things still have on those they know. Other people might even say, “Get over it” or “Move on.” But it’s usually simply not that easy.
author: Lisa Bedrick, Sexually Abused and Christian

quote: I have heard that Paganism is for broken people, but life cracks everyone in some way. We are a religion of healing people.
author: Thomm Quackenbush, Pagan Standard Times: Essays on the Craft
category: broken, healing, life, pagan, paganism, religion

quote: Awakening is not a journey of discovering a distant land or a coveted secret, but rather, it is a journey of surrendering to what has always been present but shrouded in illusion and disillusion.
author: Shavasti, Embracing the Power of Truth

quote: Healing comes through God's work, and God deals differently with us when we deal differently with him.
author: Rosaria Champagne Butterfield

quote: Loving someone isn’t about fairy tales or control. None of us walk through the world unwounded. Love is simply giving someone a safe space to grow and heal, and that’s how we have to love ourselves as well.
author: James Avery Fuchs, Gasoline and Winter

quote: Doctors
author: all they do is make you worse and take all your money. That's a general statement.
category: Lisa Bedrick, On Christian Hot Topics

quote: But time heals, as they say, or more to the point, fresher wounds help us to forget the old scars.
author: Rudy Schwartz (Joe Newman)

quote: I could not see beauty until I held hands with chaos in silence.
author: Vironika Tugaleva
category: beauty, chaos, emotional-healing, healing, mindfulness, self-awareness, the-love-mindset

quote: When a plan fails, it does not mean we have failed. It just means we need a new plan.
author: Jenna Alatari

quote: When I stood there, looking out the window at the raindrops and thinking of everything I lost, I forgot everything I have. When I remembered the things I have, I forgot I lost anything at all.
author: Jenna Alatari

quote: Love is the only way. There has been enough pain, enough war, enough killing. Enough. No more.
author: Ellen Newhouse, Nothing Ever Goes On Here

quote: The pain of childhood walks beside me as a friend, it teaches me how to invite the stillness of compassion - Shavasti
author: Shavasti, Embracing the Power of Truth

quote: When I stood there, looking out the window at the raindrops and thinking of everything I lost, I forgot everything I have. When I remembered everything I have, I forgot everything I lost.
author: Jenna Alatari

quote: I had built such a wall between my experiences and how I felt about those experiences that I was incapable of reliving both simultaneously. I could talk about my traumas, even walk through them, but I couldn’t feel them. When I tried to bring it all together, when I tried to remember how I had felt, I disappeared in my own head. My to-do list took on grave importance. The book I read the night before filled my thoughts. Yesterday’s article suddenly called out to be rewritten. I couldn’t get inside myself.
author: Sarah Hackley, Women Will Save the World

quote: It was painful to contemplate the distance between the future of accomplishment I'd imagined for myself twenty years earlier...it was painful to understand that the cushion of exceptionality invoked by the drug had made me oblivious to my inertia. And it was painful to have to define myself again, at an age when most people are happy in their own skins.
author: Ann Marlowe
category: addiction, coping, drug-addiction, growing, healing, heroin, mental-illness, recovery

quote: People like to say that time heals all wounds, but I don't believe it. I remember once Grandpa took me firewood cutting, and as we looked at the rings of the tree together, he pointed out the years where there was drought and the years where there was fire. So while time allowed for new growth that hid the scars of the past, those scars were still there, inside the tree, and part of the tree. I think about how I am like that tree.
author: Kaya McLaren, Church of the Dog

quote: The only way to get over the pain is to face it, embrace it, hug it and learn the lessons embedded within it.
author: Adele Theron

quote: I have found out the hard way that the path from victim to victory hinges on one word…Choose.
author: Tam Hodge, And Now I Choose: A Story for Those Who Believe They Have No Choice

quote: Part of the process in healing from trauma, like recovering from addiction, is developing connection and support with others.
author: Stephanie S. Covington, Beyond Trauma: A Healing Journey For Women

quote: Life requires of man spiritual elasticity, so that he may temper his efforts to the chances that are offered.
author: Viktor E. Frankl

quote: Abuse? Ah. Such problems, even with time, do not go away on their own. They must be addressed. André Chevalier
author: Nikki Sex, Abuse
category: abuse, abuse-recovery, counseling, healing, healing-abuse, sexual-abuse

quote: Nothing heals better than saying good truthful words to oneself. If the heart feels them, everything else gets better.
author: Rola Mahmoud

quote: All things are possible to those who believe:
author: Bible. New International Version Mark 9 23

quote: Since we human beings are the cause of the environmental problems that we face today, we can also be the solution. We just need a shift in our thinking. We just need to move away from the paradigm of competition and domination. Then this world will not end. In fact, the world will prosper and return to its original place as the cradle of self-discovery and the advancement of human spirituality. And such a world is a true democracy.
author: Seung Heun Lee, Healing Society: A Prescription for Global Enlightenment

quote: The body protects itself, and the same happens in the mind. It occurs sluggishly and imperfectly, a bad job done by indifferent craftsmen, but within minutes an accretion of defence mechanisms starts to form around the trauma, blunting its edges, eventually sealing it away inside scar tissue. Like a sliver of glass buried deep in a cut, the event will never go away, and often a movement will cause it to nudge a nerve ending and burn like fire for a while. However much it hurts when that happens, the last thing you want.
author: Michael Marshall, The Straw Men

quote: No matter how much you cry, the tears will dry. No matter how many nightmares, flashbacks, visions, or terrors you endure, they will pass. To weather these in order to find your true self and the happiness you deserve, that is not a risk. To waste the time you have in this body, never showing your soul to yourself or anyone else, living in fearful misery – that is really the most dangerous thing you can do.
author: Vironika Tugaleva, The Love Mindset
category: authenticity, emotional-healing, fear, flashbacks, healing, nightmares, open, self-healing, soul, trauma, vulnerability, vulnerable

quote: Who can see inside the deepest recesses of your imagination and manifest those wishes into your daily experience? Who can appreciate those subtle nuances of character you've acquired by overcoming your deepest fears? Who can truly respect those things that are no longer a part of you because of all your work to release them? Who can see the strength left behind in the wake of your unique struggles and obstacles? Who will see you for who you are, appreciating everything that is there, everything that is not, everything that can be, if you do not? Who else can?
author: Vironika Tugaleva
category: healing, responsibility, self-awareness, self-care, self-compassion, self-knowledge, self-respect

quote: You really don't have to burn any bridges to let go... You don't have to destroy anything. You can just decide to cross over and move on.
author: Marta Mrotek, Miracle in Progress Workbook: A Workbook for Holistic Recovery

quote: There is no greater gift than realizing the constant presence of the Divine and His Absolute Power to create and restore all things.
author: Marta Mrotek, Miracle in Progress: A Handbook for Holistic Recovery

quote: No one escapes the wounding of the soul. You, much like me may have many questions of a painful past and focus on that pain. Maybe you have sought love and affection only to be used and left empty inside. Even now you close yourself off determined never to be hurt again so no one will ever see the beauty that lies within. I want to tell you as a woman or man you are highly valued in the eyes of God. You are His Crowning jewel of all creation. You are the pearl. We are all pearls of great value.
author: Cecibel Contreras, Rainbows in the Dark

quote: On angel's wings, love flew in.
author: Renee Dyer, Eyes Wide Open
category: adri, angsty-love, healing, letting-love-in, starting-over, tucker-stavros

quote: When you touch someone who authentically represents a tradition, you not only touch his or her tradition, you also touch your own.
author: Thich Nhat Hanh

quote: Nature does not know of the challenges that face us. No matter what money difficulties we have, the sun will continue to shine. If it is health challenges we face, the grass will continue to grow. If a relationship is causing us grief, the ocean breeze will continue to blow. Taking a breath away from our challenges, and recognizing the nature around us, can help open the door to our Divine nature and allow the healing to begin.
author: Charles F. Glassman
category: healing, inner-healing, inspirational-quotes, motivational-quotes, nature-quotes, nature-s-beauty

quote: Victory takes risk and risk takes courage to overcome the evil demons from our past.
author: Cecibel Contreras

quote: There was no point in telling somebody not to cry, she had always thought; indeed there were times when you should do exactly the opposite, when you should urge people to cry, to start the healing that sometimes only tears can bring. But if there was a place for tears of relief, there might even be a place for tears of pride[.]
author: Alexander McCall Smith, The Good Husband of Zebra Drive

quote: Nature does not know of the challenges that face us. No matter what money difficulties we have, the sun will continue to shine. If it is health challenges we face, the grass will continue to grow. If a relationship is causing us grief, the ocean breeze will continue to blow. Taking a breathe away from our challenges, and recognizing the nature around us, can help open the door to our Divine nature and allow the healing to begin.
author: Charles F. Glassman, Brain Drain   The Breakthrough That Will Change Your Life
category: healing, inner-healing, inspirational-quotes, motivational-quotes, nature-quotes, nature-s-beauty

quote: Recreate your life, always, always. Remove the stones, plant rose bushes and make sweets." Begin again.
author: Cora Coralina

quote: But time soon passes. Even the deepest pain eventually loses its edge in the more vivid reality of the present; then, what once was unbearable becomes strangely familiar. And after much familiarity, it assumes the insignificance of just another milestone, ever marking the journey to higher ground.
author: N. Maria Kwami, Secrets of the Bending Grove

quote: Add these affirmations:"Bright LifeParticles are energizing my body.""Every cell in my body vibrates with energy and health.
author: Ilchi Lee, LifeParticle Meditation: A Practical Guide to Healing and Transformation

quote: Recreate your life, always, always. Remove the stones, plant rose bushes and make sweets. Begin again.
author: Cora Coralina

quote: You're not broken beyond repair there is hope. There is a God who knows all the pain you endure and will heal, protect and rejuvenate you.
author: Pauline Seaport

quote: Hope: Hold on, persistence effort!
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!
category: determination, determination-quotes, determined, determined-spirit, determinism, encourage-yourself, encouragement-quotes, healing, healing-the-past, healthy-living, hope-and-despair, hope-and-faith, hope-and-life, hope-for-each-day, hopeful, hopeful-and-encouraging, inspirational-quotes, motivational-quotes, optimism-quotes, optimistic, persistence-quotes, persistent-actions, persistent-attitude, persistent-life

quote: Renunciation isn't a moral imperative or a form of self-denial. It's simply cooperation with the way things are: for moments do pass away, one after the other. Resisting this natural unfolding doesn't change it; resistance only makes it painful. So we renounce our resistance, our noncooperation, our stubborn refusal to enter life as it is. We renounce our fantasy of a beautiful past and an exciting future we can cherish and hold on to. Life just isn't like this. Life, time, is letting go, moment after moment. Life and time redeem themselves constantly, heal themselves constantly, only we don't know this, and much as we long to be healed and redeemed, we refuse to recognize this truth. This is why the sirens' songs are so attractive and so deadly. They propose a world of indulgence and wishful thinking, an unreal world that is seductive and destructive. (142)
author: Norman Fischer, Sailing Home: Using the Wisdom of Homer's Odyssey to Navigate Life's Perils and Pitfalls

quote: To enjoy true, vibrant health, increased awareness, effort, and focus are required.
author: Rand Olson, Children of Promise: The Ultimate Guide to Raising Healthy Kids

quote: Medication, surgery, and medical tests are all focused on disease, not on health. Prevention is the act of moving away from the disease. Proactivity in health is seeking a high level of wellness and acting in a way that will create that reality in your life.
author: Rand Olson, Children of Promise: The Ultimate Guide to Raising Healthy Kids

quote: In the experience is the emotion. In the emotion is the gift.
author: Patricia Brooks

quote: What we sometimes see as annoying, incessant questions from a child may be a plea for recognition. Maybe they do not need an answer as much as attention.
author: Rand Olson, Children of Promise: The Ultimate Guide to Raising Healthy Kids

quote: Over time our tears will help heal the pain and soothe the hurt.
author: Harley King, It's Okay to Cry: Warm, Compassionate Stories That Help You Find Hope and Healing After the Death of a Pet

quote: A burdened heart doesn't equate to a lack of faith. The God of Abraham, Isaac and Jacob can heal with a simple command. The burden comes from wondering if that's His will and may it be done.
author: Donna Lynn Hope

quote: Oh, darlin’, I’m gonna walk you through it, kiss you through it, feel you through it, taste you through it. Hell, I’m hoping you call out my name through it, but for some reason, if I can’t get you off, by all means, play along. It won’t hurt my feelings. But I don’t think you’ll need to.
author: Beverly Preston, Surviving Broken
category: cowboyisms, erotic-romance, happily-ever-after, healing, heartbroken, love, romance-book-quotes, sexy, steamy-romance

quote: Journal writing is a wonderful pathway to self-awareness.
author: Rand Olson, Children of Promise: The Ultimate Guide to Raising Healthy Kids

quote: Come, come into this circle of grace and friendship.Come bringing only your open heart.You owe us nothing but truth, you need no heavy armor here.Show us your beautiful scars, the evidence of adventures you’ve survived.Tell your stories from the road.This space is home.You are safe to come as you are without fear.
author: Jacob Nordby
category: grace, healing, healing-the-emotional-self, heart, inspirational-quotes, vulnerability, wounds

quote: The simple, humble, almighty, supreme virtue of love is the invincible fire of transformation for healing the world.
author: Bryant McGill, Simple Reminders: Inspiration for Living Your Best Life
category: almighty, healing, humbleness, invincibility, love, simplicity, supremacy, transformative, virtues

quote: There was so much about our past that I still didn't understand, and I wasn't one to tell the future. I could only tell the way the world worked. History was a tangled thing, people were resilient, and the one constant law of the world was that it would heal.
author: Brenna Yovanoff, Fiendish

quote: Your highest purpose and calling is often really calling for your own healing
author: Bryant McGill, Simple Reminders: Inspiration for Living Your Best Life

quote: To give up power to change for the better is inherently distasteful to everyone, and to force people to affirm that they are addicts or alcoholics so they can speak in a meeting is shameful and demoralizing.
author: Chris Prentiss, The Alcoholism and Addiction Cure
category: addiction-cure, addiction-treatment, alcohol-abuse, alcoholic, alcoholism, change, chris-prentiss, healing, healing-abuse, holistic-treatment, life-improvement, non-12-step, passages-malibu, passages-rehab, passages-treatment, passages-ventura, pax-prentiss, philosophy, recovering-addict, recovery, rehab, self-help, therapy

quote: The art of living is to fall in love over and over again.It is no easy thing to walk through the world with an open heart, embracing everything, and also stand true, allowing no poison to infect us.But be cracked open often.Pour yourself into life withholding nothing. Heal and be healed. This is the way of living in full.
author: Jacob Nordby

quote: All that crap about time being a great healer is bullshit. Time heals nothing. Well, acne maybe.
author: Saurbh Katyal, Seduced by Murder

quote: it’s okay to love onseLf unconditionally so tHat U truly know U &can recognize the embedded healing & curing aspects &properties buried with-in U & Eye (all of us]
author: Irucka Ajani Embry, Balancing the Rift: Reconnectualizing the Pasenture
category: curing, healing, love, oneself, unconditional-love, yourself

quote: Writing is more than just a method to tell stories. It’s a way to find healing, and to healing others.
author: M. Kirin
category: healing, inspiration, writer, writer-inspiration, writing, writing-advice

quote: We wouldn't have much need of a war if people stopped using drugs. It's like taking up a fight against the use of headache remedies
author: it will never work until the condition causing people's headache pain is healed.
category: Chris Prentiss, The Alcoholism and Addiction Cure

quote: Do not partner with fear to help you make decisions
author: Jeannette Gregory

quote: Love and mercy heals;where nothing works, love does..
author: Henrietta Newton Martin

quote: Your body will heal itself, through gentle and peaceful cooperation with the inherent wisdom and intelligence within.
author: Bryant McGill, Simple Reminders: Inspiration for Living Your Best Life
category: cooperation, gentleness, healing, intelli, peace, wisdom

quote: Healing light shines upon your soul even when the clouds roll in and the sky goes gray. The beauty of your rainbow fills the space between the gray and the blue providing balance to your soul. I see the rainbow's reflection in your eyes always. May God's light maintain the vibrant color of your heart.
author: Jason Micheal Ratliff

quote: The sad part was that everything I said was true but I was going about the healing in entirely the wrong way. As I was to be taught later, you can’t heal the sick by force-feeding them with ideas they’re not ready to accept; you can’t cure people by the simple imposition of your will. It’s the power of the Holy Spirit that heals, not the power of a would-be wonder-worker trying to play God.
author: Susan Howatch, Mystical Paths

quote: Religion is also a process of healing, I discovered – a healing of the soul. Even our language points to this relation. The words ‘holy’, ‘wholesome’ and ‘healing’ all have the same root. (In German, this is even more striking: heilig, heil and heilen.) Muslims believe that all humans are born in a state of purity, our fitra, and it is only in the course of our lives that we tarnish our soul through bad habits and wrong behaviour. Through spiritual practices such as prayer, recitation of Quran and dhikr we can cleanse these acquired ‘black spots’ in our soul and return towards our original primordial nature. More so, dhikr is said to enliven the heart.
author: Kristiane Backer, From MTV to Mecca: How Islam Inspired My Life

quote: I think you've got to get out whatever's hurting you through your art, so it doesn't twist you up inside.
author: Cheryl Rainfield, Scars
category: cherylrainfield, cutting, healing, lgbt, lgbtq, scars, selfharm, selfmutilation, sexualabuse, survivor, ya, yalit

quote: I know you're upset, I know you're scared, but don't walk away.
author: Cheryl Rainfield, Scars
category: cherylrainfield, cutting, healing, lgbt, lgbtq, scars, selfharm, selfmutilation, sexualabuse, survivor, ya, yalit

quote: There is no disease, no sickness, no problem, and no circumstance that cannot be overcome by the healing power of God's love. God wants to heal you! He wants you to be made whole. Call on Him. Cry out to Him. Trust in Him. Have faith. God hears you, and He will help you more than you can ever imagine.
author: Lydia  Marshall, To God Be the Glory: A Personal Testimony of God's Healing Power

quote: Interact with others as if you are radiating happiness and healing from within.
author: Franklin Gillette

quote: I know I'm not to blame for what he did. And I know, too, that I am strong inside--stronger than I ever realized.
author: Cheryl Rainfield, Stained
category: abduction, cheryl-rainfield, cherylrainfield, healing, healing-abuse, rape, stained, strong-female-characters, strong-girl, ya, yalit

quote: If I want to get out of here, I have to be the one to save myself.
author: Cheryl Rainfield, Stained
category: abduction, cheryl-rainfield, cherylrainfield, healing, healing-from-abuse, rape, stained, strong-female-characters, strong-girl, ya, ya-psychological-suspense, ya-thriller, yalit

quote: We have often done well knowing the mind of God in our churches today. We have not done as well knowing His heart. We have largely become a church that pursues insights, principles, and theological concepts. No other church in history has had sounder theology or has known as much about God as many of our churches do today. However, we seem to know so little about His heart. Maybe this has troubled you, too. With all our insight, all our knowledge, all our information, and all our depth of theology, we seem to have so much difficulty functioning in the most basic Christian things, like personal holiness and loving people more than things. In our churches we are so easily hurt, and we hold on to those hurts for so long. We easily walk away from one another and quickly leave our churches when we experience disappointments and failures. There is often much judging and little compassion. Too many people remain alone in their pain.God desires to reveal His heart to us and to build His heart into us as we seek His face. Insight alone does not transform us; only the things that flow from the heart of God transform the lives of people. As God opens His heart to be known by us and as He builds His heart into us, His love will flow through us to those who are in desperate need of His forgiveness, His compassion, His healing, and His life.
author: Bill Mills, Adequate: How God Empowers Ordinary People to Serve
category: church, god, healing, knowing-god, the-heart-of-god, the-mind-of-god, theology, transformation

quote: As he stared into the ocean, he must have tossed a lifetime of apologies into its silence. Maybe he thought the tide would wash his troubles away.
author: Diane Keaton, Then Again
category: healing, introvertedness, life, mindfulness, nature, regrets

quote: Guilt can interfere with our desires to move forward, to heal properly and to become a person who has the mental health and means of proper recompense.
author: Bryant McGill, Simple Reminders: Inspiration for Living Your Best Life
category: becoming, desires, guilt, healing, moving-forward, recompense

quote: True healers know that wellness is the order of the day, so they do not allow themselves, even for a moment, to see anything other than that. So, the power of the healer is in the power to influence the one who needs to be healed into a vibration that allows the healing that they are summoning. (that they could get, even without the healer, but they can get faster with a healer's influence).
author: Abraham Hicks

quote: The path that takes us from here, to the fulfillment of our life purpose is who we are. We are the bridge to our destiny." (From the Secrets to Divine Manifestations)
author: Alain Yaovi M. Dagba, Secrets to Divine Manifestations: Finding Your Life Purpose Through the Rebirth of Your Soul
category: affirmations, christ, confidence-and-attitude, consciousness, dreams, healing, life, prayers, purpose, success

quote: Memoir writing draws on all aspects of who we are, body, mind and soul. We are challenged to dig deep, to remember, and once again inhabit the skin of who we were and what we have learned. Writing memoir is an act of testimony, witnessing, healing. When you write a memoir, you draw upon layers of your consciousness and discover your true nature, your essential self, and are transformed the process.” Linda Joy Meyer
author: Rossandra White

quote: Of course, we often think we have to get sick literally in order to get the rest or pleasure we need in our lives. Bobbie and I therefore taught our children when they were younger that if they needed a day off from school, they should just say that and take a health day, not a sick day. That made them look at life differently. I think all of us need to rethink our attitudes toward health and sickness.
author: Bernie S. Siegel, Peace, Love and Healing: Bodymind Communication  the Path to Self-Healing: An Exploration

quote: She collapsed. I stepped forward and caught her. I thought of two trees nearly unrooted and leaning against each other.
author: Peter Heller, The Dog Stars

quote: My lungs filled deep with the sweet scent that came of his skin. it was like there had never been any hole in my chest. i was perfect- not healed but as if there never had been a wound in the first place.
author: Stephenie Meyer, New Moon

quote: Healing is the hardest thing you'll ever do.' ~Quinn
author: C.J. Redwine, Deliverance

quote: We don't yet know, above all, what the world might be like if children were to grow up without being subjected to humiliation, if parents would respect them and take them seriously as people.
author: Alice  Miller
category: abuse, bullying, child-abuse, childhood-trauma, freedom, healing, kids, liberty, peace

quote: Healing is a different type of pain. It’s the pain of becoming aware of the power of one’s strength and weakness, of one’s capacity to love or do damage to oneself and to others, and of how the most challenging person to control in life is ultimately yourself.
author: Caroline Myss

quote: You can't sweep something broken into a bag and call it whole. It takes repair.
author: Paula Heller Garland

quote: Homeopathy is the true and very advanced healing science much beyond the scope of current methods of chemical analysis and interpretation.
author: Aditya Sardana, Ayahuasca - The Sacred Psychedelic!!
category: chemical-analysis, healing, healing-science, homeopathy, science, trues, truths

quote: Finding the right healing path requires all or nothing. Once you place conditions on healing, all you can achieve is conditional healing.
author: Caroline Myss, Why People Don't Heal and How They Can: A Practical Programme for Healing Body, Mind and Spirit

quote: In order to heal themselves, people must recognize, first, that they have an inner guidance deep within and, second, that they can trust it.
author: Shakti Gawain

quote: A deep wound inside him began to heal. And he suddenly knew that being separated from this woman would only bring him a certain sadness.
author: Catherine DePasquale, A Future Spring

quote: [M]y only route was trust: trust in a *deeper* wisdom, the wisdom responsible for making my heart beat, my eyes shine, my hair grow; trust in the infinite intelligence responsible for making my cells replicate; trust in the part of me that is awake when I'm asleep at night.
author: Brandon Bays, The Journey: A Practical Guide to Healing Your Life and Setting Yourself Free

quote: Inside, I found three things: a silver mirror, a silk handkerchief, and a glass flask of ointment. These items will help you on your journey. use them when need be. If you ever lose faith in yourself, the mirror will show your inner beauty. In case your reputation is stained, the handkerchief will remind you of how pure your heart is. As for the balm, it will heal your wounds, both inside and outside.
author: Elif Shafak, The Forty Rules of Love
category: balm, beauty, faith, healing, journey, ointment, purity, reputation

quote: Unhealthy behavior is actually common among doctors, who tend to know a lot about medicine but very little about health.
author: Sol Luckman, Snooze: A Story of Awakening
category: comedy, doctor, funny, healing, health, humor, illness, lifestyle, md, medicine, physician, poor-health, unhealthy, wellbeing, wellness

quote: We are not the only ones affected by our recovery. The spiritual awakening heals the world one person at a time.
author: Marta Mrotek, Miracle in Progress: A Handbook for Holistic Recovery

quote: When one becomes centered in love, then and only then will all paths become open to them
author: Timothy Moran, The Twelve Messages of the Spiritual Heart: A Novel of Transformation

quote: If it is the will of God for man to be sick, no one in history violated the will of God more than Jesus. Just as God desires all men to be saved, He also desires all men to be healed.
author: Praying Medic, Divine Healing Made Simple: Simplifying the supernatural to make healing & miracles a part of your everyday life

quote: Every heart needs healing.
author: Veronica L. Anderson

quote: Sometimes therapy takes years and years, and sometimes it can happen in one miraculous instant, a lifetime of doubt and self-hatred healed in a moment of astounding love.
author: Mia Sheridan, Stinger

quote: Your job is not to judge. Your job is not to figure out if someone deserves something. Your job is to lift the fallen, to restore the broken, and to heal the hurting.
author: Joel Osteen

quote: This is how the soul heals. it thaws out bit by bit, the way the ground warms after a hard winter. you notive the sun or hear the whippoorwill calling across the flats. You sweep your porch, go drink coffee in the shade of the trumpet vines. You have days where you want to lay down and die, but what you learn is this: As long as there's somebody left on this earth who loves you, it's reason enough to stay alive. You don't give in to your broke heart-- you just let the wide, cracked space fill up again.
author: Michael Lee West, American Pie

quote: A body can't run from what they done. They carry it with them inside. It fester and spread like poison if it's buried. It gotta be out in the air where it can heal.
author: Susan Crandall, Whistling Past the Graveyard

quote: There is no elegance in hate, but there is tremendous beauty in the unintended revenge of living well and being happy.
author: Victoria Malin Gregory
category: beauty, happy, hate, healing, loathing, reprisal, retribution, revenge, vengeance

quote: Your mental problem becomes a solution when it can be used to solve problems.
author: Michael Bassey Johnson
category: ability, brain-power, cure, disability, disease, diseases, disorder, heal, healing, innovation, intelligence, knowledge, mental, michael-bassey-johnson, problem, solution, solve, solving, talent, talents, trouble, wisdom, wits

quote: I can always recognize the fellow wounded.
author: Suzette Mayr, Monoceros
category: community, healing, lgbtq, lgbtqia, recovery, support

quote: Want more energy? Drink water. Sleep deep. Love passionately. Eat clean. Forgive completely. Create something new.
author: Toni Sorenson

quote: It takes a lot of grace and maturity to simply forgive, but a lot of healing takes place when you do.
author: Elizabeth George
category: blessed, christian, forgive, god, grace, heal, healing, mature, place, simple

quote: Healing is active involvement in your process, ongoing.
author: S. Kelley Harrell, Gift of the Dreamtime - Reader's Companion

quote: To take such a complex creature, on who was meant for God and is destroyed by sin, and attempt to understand how the development of that creature can be affected by hideous trauma is to attempt the impossible.
author: Diane Mandt Langberg, Counseling Survivors of Sexual Abuse

quote: There's an undeniable healing power in telling the truth to someone who validates you by simply listening . . . honor washes away the stench of shame.
author: Jo Ann Fore, When a Woman Finds Her Voice: Overcoming Life's Hurts & Using Your Story to Make a Difference

quote: An unceasingly grateful life can easily heal from the wounds of hurt and setback. It can also easily shed resentment, hate, and bitterness…
author: Assegid Habtewold, The 9 Cardinal Building Blocks: For Continued Success in Leadership
category: bitterness, gratefulness, hate, healing, hurt, resentment, setback, wounds

quote: As we come into balance within ourselves and the all that is, we balance the past, future and our Earth.
author: Jan Porter, "Soul Skin, Woman have you had enough?" fiction by; Jan Porter

quote: Time heals all wounds. Il tempo guarisce tutti i mali. It’s been said time and time again, but what they don’t talk about are the jagged scars left behind. What they don’t tell you is that sometimes, when ignored, the wounds fester
author: J.M. Darhower, Sempre: Redemption

quote: Being broken isn't the worst thing. We can be mended and put together again. We don’t have to be ashamed of our past. We can embrace the history that gives us value, and see our cracks as beautiful.
author: Anna White, Mended: Thoughts on Life, Love, and Leaps of Faith
category: brokenness, christian-living, healing, inspirational, memoir, mended, recovery, repair, uplifting, wholeness

quote: Harboring anger, hatred and resentment within you, is containing the venom within you. You are the only one affected...
author: Jacqueline Ripstein, The Art of HealingArt: The Keys to Power and Awareness
category: anger, hatred, healing, healing-the-emotional-self, healing-the-past, pain, peace, resentment, war

quote: You think you can avoid [pain,] but you actually can't. If you do, you just get sicker, or you feel more pain. But if you can speak it, if you can write it, if you can paint it, it is very healing.
author: Alice Walker

quote: I shower in the dark, barely able to tell soap from conditioner, and tell myself that I will emerge new and strong, that the water will heal me.
author: Veronica Roth, Insurgent

quote: Colors are vibrating light energies, each “color ray” produces a sound that affects matter.
author: Jacqueline Ripstein, The Art of HealingArt: The Keys to Power and Awareness
category: art-healing, color, color-healing, colors-of-life, healing, healing-art, power, vibrations

quote: For the first time in ages I felt a tiny pinprick in my heart--not like it was breaking, but like something small and unseen had begun sewing it closed again.
author: Leslea Tash, Bird After Bird

quote: A song for you  A song for me Is how we relate our life to be
author: Patty Smith, The Children's Hour
category: a-rude-awakening, healing, in-search-of-the-inner-child, infidality, love, nurture-of-oneself, romance, self-love-self-respect

quote: This book attempts to record a journey to restoration that applies to ordinary people like you and I. It is a shot towards healing. A step headed for a new consciousness. It emerges from a moment in time where all seems lost.
author: Phindiwe Nkosi, Behind the Hospital
category: book, conscience, conscious, consciousness, faith, healing, hope, lost, moon, new, pain, sun

quote: Peter remained on friendly terms with Christ notwithstanding Christ's having healed his mother-in-law.
author: Samuel Butler
category: christ, friendly, healing, humor, mother-in-law, peter

quote: Healing stories are magickal tales born from personal tribulation and victory, which are then shared.
author: S. Kelley Harrell, Teen Spirit Guide to Modern Shamanism
category: healing, healing-story, hollow-bone, shamanic-narrative, shamanism, wounded-healer

quote: I do not claim to be a healer: only God is the Healer.
author: Phindiwe Nkosi, Behind the Hospital
category: book, claim, god, gods, gods-love, healer, healing, help, i, love, loving, pain

quote: When my heart yearn for silence in a crowd full of cheerful people, thats not the lonliness i seek but want to feel the rustling of my abandoned desires pouring upon the broken hearts. All the noise i want to here now is the symphony of love and of healing.
author: Annie Ali

quote: Time does not heal wounds. It's a body's ritual that does. The instinctual cleansing with rain or other waters, the application of salves. Despite the sting. Even neglected, the body begins to take care. To repair itself. Blood clots, tissues regenerate, flesh scars. Soon, the thin white line is the only evidence of the pain. It is the body, not time. Time does nothing except create distance between the body and that which caused it harm. Recollection of fear can be stronger than the original fear itself. Similarly, bliss is sometimes more vivid when recollected. How else do you explain longing? Longing for what has already passed. That's the real pain. But you insisted, you pried with your fingers to see. You retuned to me after I turned away. You made me recollect for you, collect again and again for you, interrupting the healing with your curiosity. Now that I have given you the words, you may long for them. You may miss me. You may try to find the notes to the song again and again and won't be able to find them. Perhaps, the wounds I made will already have begun to scar. Maybe the body will have begun its ritual of forgetting. I told you not to ask for haunted, not to ask me to recollect. Because recollection is like tearing at closed wounds. Like pealing back the careful tissue put there by the body to make it safe. And because remembered pain is always worse than the original pain, because this time it is expected. This time you already know how much it will hurt.
author: T. Greenwood

quote: I've always told people that for each person there is a sentence--a series of words--which has the power to destroy him. When Fat told me about Leon Stone I realized (this came years after the first realization) that another sentence exists, another series of words, which will heal the person. If you're lucky you will get the second; but you can be certain of getting the first: that is the way it works.
author: Philip K. Dick, VALIS

quote: But sometimes things happen that no one hopes for. Events that cause everything you've worked towards, the life you've carefully constructed piece by piece, to come tumbling down all around you. No one is to blame, but you're left with a wound you can't heal on your own and can't believe you'll ever learn to accept, so you struggle to escape the pain. Only time can heal wounds as deep as that - a lot of time - and all you can really do is place yourself in its hands and try to consider the passing of each day a victory. You tough it out moment by moment, hour by hour, and after some weeks or months you begin to see signs of recovery. Slowly the wound heals into a scar.
author: Ryū Murakami, Audition

quote: There's great peace in surrendering to principles
author: Stefan Molyneux
category: ethics, first-principles, healing, morals, phylosophy, rationality

quote: Through depression and many other dark low emotions, our Light dims and our immune system declines along with it. White blood cells are the physical Light of our body.Colors can be used to heal, restore and to uplift us.
author: Jacqueline Ripstein, The Art of HealingArt: The Keys to Power and Awareness
category: art, conscious-awareness, healing, healing-the-emotional-self, healing-the-past, inspirational, inspirational-attitude, inspirational-quotes, motivational, spiritual-growth

quote: Healing comes by faith. Faith is destroyed by doubt. If you doubt whether God wants people to be healed, you won’t see them healed.
author: Praying Medic, Divine Healing Made Simple: Simplifying the supernatural to make healing & miracles a part of your everyday life

quote: Healing is not healed.Numbed is not healed.Healing takes time.Healing takes patience.Healing takes love.Healing sometimes triggers anger or sadness or sorrow or guilt or regret.Long suppressed.Long unaddressedSo we make up that healing is wrong,useless and to be avoidedAnd we head back to numbingAnd look for love and connectionWith the numbed and suppressed,unaddressed and repressed...Give space for the damageGive space for the healingLet the healing begin and begin and begin.........
author: Dave Rudbarg

quote: It turns out that sharing the past with someone is different from reliving it when you're alone. It feels less like a wound and more like a poultice.
author: Jodi Picoult, The Storyteller

quote: Hemlock's attentions had not only healed Aelfric's body of its wounds but also given him curious sensitivity. Aside from the voice in his mind, he felt things in the natural surroundings: the presence of beasts, the whispers of trees to the overcast skies, anger in the earth and sea. Ravens followed him around as they did wolves. And he had developed a rough ability to see in the dark.
author: F.T. McKinstry, Ascarion

quote: There are but a few blood purifiers and these are all in the body. We know them as the liver, kidneys, lungs, colon, and a few glands.
author: Herbert M. Shelton, Getting Well
category: healing, health, hygiene, medical, medical-treatment, medicine

quote: I kissed him and let that emotion consume me, to settle the pain that had risen inside my soul—to heal the pain I knew he felt. I let it consume and override the doubt that all we really needed was one another. That this empty hole could be filled with the love we felt for one another.
author: Cassandra Giovanni, Faded Perfection

quote: All people cross the line from childhood to adulthood with a secondhand opinion of who they are. Without any questioning, we take as truth whatever our parents and other influentials have said about us during our childhood, whether these messages are communicated verbally, physically, or silently.
author: Heyward Bruce Ewart III, AM I BAD? Recovering From Abuse
category: abuse, abuse-survivors, belief-system, child-abuse, child-abuse-survivors, core-beliefs, dysfunctional-families, emotional-abuse, healing, influence, manipulation, parenting, parents, survivors

quote: What she did not know, and would never have believed, was that though her soul seemed to have been grown over with an impenetrable layer of mould, some delicate blades of grass, young and tender, were already pushing their way upwards, destined to take root and send out living shoots so effectively that her all-consuming grief would soon be lost and forgotten. The wound was healing from inside.
author: Leo Tolstoy, War and Peace

quote: How you react to the issue, IS the issue.
author: Habib Sadeghi, Within

quote: And yet, I was scared of falling asleep, because the moment I fell asleep my wounds would heal and right then I didn’t want that to happen. Right then, I found a strange but real comfort in the pain.
author: Matt Haig, The Humans

quote: It appears that DDNOS is the intentional goal of these abusers, but DID sometimes results from a failure of programming. In DDNOS, the ANP is always present, even when another part is in control of the behavior and feelings.
author: Alison Miller, Healing the Unimaginable: Treating Ritual Abuse and Mind Control
category: anp, ddnos, dissociation, dissociative-disorder, dissociative-identity-disorder, healing, osdd, personality-system, recovery, ritual-abuse, satanic-ritual-abuse, survivors

quote: For some reason, I thought Victor could heal that wound better than anyone else. It's strange to think that this vampire, the embodiment of all my hatred, could act like a suture.
author: J.A. London, Darkness Before Dawn

quote: It is important to learn about being multiple, and what works for their healing, from your client. To work with the alters, rather than trying to get the ANP to control the rest of the personality system.
author: Alison Miller, Healing the Unimaginable: Treating Ritual Abuse and Mind Control
category: anp, dissociative-identity-disorder, healing, personality-system, recovery, ritual-abuse, satanic-ritual-abuse, survivors

quote: Regardless of where I have been, I choose to step into my loving.
author: Habib Sadeghi, Within

quote: Throughout the history of medicine, including the shamanic healing traditions, the Greek tradition of Asclepius, Aristotle and Hippocrates, and the folk and religious healers, the imagination has been used to diagnose disease.
author: Jeanne Achterberg, Imagery in Healing: Shamanism and Modern Medicine

quote: What issues sidetrack you from your mission to get well?
author: Shirley Corder, Strength Renewed: Meditations for Your Journey through Breast Cancer

quote: If God is love, and nothing imperfect can exist in the presence of God; then healing is simply the process of bringing love to the places within us that are hurting.
author: Habib Sadeghi, Within

quote: The United States alone sports an inventive spectrum of psychotherapeutic sects and schools: Freudians, Jungians, Kleinians; narrative, interpersonal, transpersonal therapists; cognitive, behavioral, cognitive-behavioral practitioners; Kohutians Rogerians, Kernbergians; aficionados of control mastery, hypnotherapy, neurolingustic programming, eye movement desensitization- that list does not even complete the top twenty. The disparate doctrines of these proliferative, radiating divisions, often reach mutually exclusive conclusions about therapeutic propriety: talk about this, not that; answer questions, or don’t; sit facing the patient, next to the patient, behind the patient. Yet no approach has ever proven its method superior to any other. Strip away a therapist’s orientation, the journal he reads, the books on his shelves, the meetings he attends- the cognitive framework his rational mind demands – and what is left to define the psychotherapy he conducts?Himself. The person of the therapist is the converting catalyst, not his order or credo, not his spatial location in the room, not his exquisitely chosen words or denominational silences. So long as the rules of a therapeutic system do not hinder limbic transmission - a critical caveat - they remain inconsequential, neocortical distractions. The dispensable trappings of dogma may determine what a therapist thinks he is doing, what he talks about when he talks about therapy, but the agent of change is who he is. (186/7)
author: Thomas Lewis, A General Theory of Love
